This was pretty much the first business I had the chance to experience when I came from CA to check out this city 
This hotel is a lover paradise. If you can afford few nights in one of their casita I believe you will share some happy stories with you grand children  about the time spent in paradise.
By the way the spa and restaurant are also institutional in the city.

Five stars.

The staff at the Royal Palms is so unbelievably helpful and courteous.  I'm not sure I'm the type you might expect to find at a resort like this, but I've never detected a whiff of attitude from anyone here.

Last year, I reserved a "Royal Romance Package" which included dinner and a room, complete with champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries.  Our room was a large casita at the corner of the property, resulting in a very quiet and private experience.  Walking around the resort, you feel like you're really (as lame as it sounds typing this) in an "oasis in the desert."  The other guests have those silly, serene looks stuck to their faces.  The staff is always smiling.  Everything just seems so...leisurely.

Don't even get me started on T. Cook's.  The service and food are impeccable.  At first, the portions may seem a little smaller than you're used to, but the flavors more than make up for this.  I've eaten here a few times and the wait staff are always pleasant and conversational without intruding on our meal.

My fiance and I are currently planning our wedding here in the small, private Alegria garden.  The Royal Palms was the first and last place we toured; we just absolutely love this resort.

Royal Palms never disappoints.  My wife and I have been here a few times before and really enjoyed it.  It is the perfect place for a romantic getaway, to celebrate a special occasion, or a combination of those for a summer staycation, when the resort offers specials during low season.

We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and decided to stay overnight and enjoy the pool and spa, among other things.  Since we know we enjoyed the restaurant T. Cook's, I booked us on a Spa and Dine special, which includes credits at the Spa and T. Cook's.  I also paid extra for a romance package, which features chocolate-covered strawberries and champagne, and rose petals sprinkled on the bed at turndown (you can get them in a heart shape).  I requested the strawberries and champagne be delivered on arrival, with the rose petals around 7pm.

Check in is in an area not full of big formal desks but more of a cozy foyer with laptops.  Cool water, cookies, and even a glass of champagne awaited while checking in.  

One of the staff guided us to our casita, which had a king-sized bed, a patio out back, nice room-darkening drapes, a one-cup Keurig for tea or coffee (even decaf), a large bathroom with good-sized shower, a desk and chair and wi-fi, and a comfortable lounge chair with hassock.  It also had a Bose speaker with Bluetooth, so you could stream music from your phone to it and fill up the room (a nice way to create the right atmosphere).  While my wife was elsewhere, I called the front desk asking about the strawberries and champagne, and was told it would be coming right away.

After we changed to our bathing suits to go enjoy the pool, we waited almost 30 minutes (I told my wife there was a surprise), but no one showed up.  Finally, we just went to the pool.  We were able to find some chairs in the shade, and enjoyed the attendant who kept bringing cold water (he also takes drink and food orders).  While it is beautiful that the grounds and the pool are surrounded by many beautiful flowers, trees, and plants, some of those things float down and get in the chairs and pool.  But mostly it is like an oasis in the desert, combined with lots of birds.  It was relaxing around the pool, with piped in music varying from real relaxing to somewhat jazzy.

Some of the time my wife was in the pool I enjoyed the fitness center.  It is not large, but well-maintained, with plenty of free weights, a weight machine, and several pieces of cardio equipment.  I was the only person there the whole time.

It's fun walking the grounds with fountains in different places and lots of little nooks to sit and get out of the sun.  At night, the Tuscan-looking courtyard adjacent to some fountains is a great place to eat.  Since we had a larger brunch, we had a meat and cheese platter at that location.  I also checked at the front desk to make sure we got our romance package.

Upon return to the room, a woman from housekeeping came and delivered the food and drink, and the bed got decorated later.  My wife was thrilled with it all and it made for a very romantic evening.  

As the romance package wasn't delivered as requested, management was nice enough to comp me the cost of it without me asking.  And possibly because of that hiccup, the night manager informed me that we would have the use of a pool cabana free of charge the following day, which is quite a treat.  (And normally expensive).

The next day we picked a cabana that was mostly in the shade, and enjoyed a little fridge that contained complimentary soft drinks and a few beers.  You also can get a complimentary order of guacamole and chips.  I enjoyed chilling out in the shade while my wife floated around in the pool on a float.

We also went to the spa to get a couple's massage.  They have several rooms inside and out to relax in before and after treatments, and also to lock up your belongings.  The massage was very good, including a choice of scented lotions.  It is a lot more expensive than standalone spas, but in line with what you'd expect at a hotel or cruiseship.

I would definitely recommend Royal Palms as it has a very special personality, even though it is now owned by Hyatt.  You don't feel like it's part of a big chain. It's great to find some peace and is a great oasis in the desert.  I'll be back.  Hope to see you there.

Very nice and a great deal. Gal pals and myself flew in for a birthday weekend. 

Conveniently located pretty close to the airport. Also, running down to the shops in Scottsdale--we're right down the street. 

Feels like a home away from home. The service is very kind and accommodating. When they help you out, it feels really sincere. Pool guy, bell hop, valet, everybody.

On Friday and Saturday night though, there were weddings. So I got roped from areas that I would've liked to sit at. 

My first time to Phoenix and was pretty happy.

This hotel is BEAUTIFUL!  It's quite large, but definitely has more of a quaint, intimate feel.  The rooms are gorgeous and clean.  We attended a wedding here and the set up could not have been more beautiful.  I would definitely recommend as a venue.  Additionally, the employees who were working the wedding were extremely friendly and professional.  Everyone was more than happy to stop and answer questions or speak to us when we needed something.

The grounds are beautiful, and the room was pretty.  But it was a mess.  The dresser was falling apart, the sealant around the door was coming off, the phones didn't work, and worst of all there were both live and dead bugs all over the bathroom floor.  They had housekeeping clean them up, but then they returned.  And I'm not talking like 2-3; it was more like 50.  And they didn't offer to take anything off the bill.  It was treated very ho-humly.  Terrible customer service.  And bugs.  Lots of them.

Beautiful hotel. The grounds and amenities are gorgeous. So much fun walking around. The restaurant is top notch and the staff are super friendly. I had a wonderful experience at the spa. I can't wait to return

Yes the place is pretty but....

My sister gave me a visit for my birthday. I have mentioned a few times that I would like to try TCooks, is that the right name? Anyway she misunderstood me and reserved a room for me and my mate.  So we went, yeah it is pretty, the grounds are nice, the staff well ok I guess. They of course could not find the reservation even though my sister had already paid and I have the confirmation number. So we sat in the lobby area for a bout an hour and a half while they figured it out. Finally they sent us on to our room with a lead. He showed us the room and asked if we needed anything. Nope was our reply. The room was nice if one is in to the look, I guess many from the mid-west are. The room was small as was the bath. There was no space outside for sitting other than a chair next to the room beside us. Yes it was nice, but only to a point. That point dropped when I found out how much she paid for this room, I almost pooped my pants. I am accustomed to paying silly prices for rooms as I like nice. But my God my home is much nicer than this hotel and a whole lot more room. I have no idea what she was thinking, but I am happy she thought so much of me. So yeah if you are coming from an area where this look is not over done, it is a nice place to stay. But I would still be disappointed with the room considering the cost.

The Royal Palms has always been one of my favorite places to go in the Valley. I love their gorgeous, peaceful surroundings, and the food is always phenomenal. Growing up, we came here for almost every Easter brunch and it was incredible every time. 

The other night, I popped in to The Mix Up Bar with two girlfriends to have a drink (ok, a few drinks) and some munchies. I ordered the Aviation which is gin, maraschino liqueur, lemon juice, and creme de violet. It was so yum! For munchies, we ordered the guacamole and a caprese flatbread. Both delicious and the portions sizes were great. 

They have a Happy Hour menu from 3-6:30 which I highly recommend because their drinks and munchies can be pricey! They also have daily specials like Taco Tuesday, Local Love Wednesdays, Bourbon and Burgers Thursdays, and live music Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays. 

I will definitely be back soon!

Simply fantastic. It would be a task to find a better place to stay in Phoenix. There's other nice places I'm sure, but I don't think I'm going to even try looking.  This will be our go to hotel in Phoenix.

The only thing I don't like is fees, but that is with any hotel. You can expect to pay about $70 per night if you park a car overnight here. 

Loved everything about this place. The little casitas is what we chose, and I think worth the extra cost.

Came here for a family celebration for Friday/Saturday night stay. All the staff was great and quite friendly. It truly felt like a dream over the weekend. We stayed at one of the Valencia Casitas. Luckily enough, everyone was placed in the same court yard, making it easy to get in contact with everyone. The rooms were absolutely spectacular. Huge king sized bed with a room that was beautifully furnished with a working fireplace. The bathroom was huge, lots of area to get ready. In the room, a book about the history of the resort was available with all the spectacular pictures of each type of room. 

Compared to the picture in the history book, the renovation of the bar looks great. We stopped by on our first night and had a few drinks. We are from Las Vegas, so to say that bar looked great.... is a great compliment. We also had lunch and breakfast at T Cook's. The service we got was great each time. The sever remember we were here for an 80th birthday, so each time, he brought out a complimentary desert tray. 

Overall, I had a fantastic time. I wish I could still be there right now and I hope I will be able to visit within the next couple of months again.

My very favorite hotel in Phoenix. It's borderline Scottsdale actually. Quaint yet sophisticated, the hotel is a former residence turned clubhouse for a 9- hole golf course, which is long gone.  The hotel expanded, built a beautiful spa and large pool, along with a great restaurant called T. Cooks. Try to get a Casita on the west side of the property. I stayed recently in the Spa Hacienda, which had 2 queen beds and a big sitting area, outdoor patio with fireplace, and a wet bar. It was next to the pool, but still private. Great service!

This review is for Alvadora - the spa at the Royal Palms. [cue angelic voices...**ahhhhhh**] 

The lovely presented me with a spa gift cert for three services. When I arranged the appointment, I asked if I could increase the massage time from 60 to 90 minutes in lieu of the second service and was told 'of course'. So I booked a 90 minute stone massage and a pedicure. 

The day of the appointment - my birthday - I was greeted with a 'happy birthday' and shown to the women's shower/changing/steam room. Its not fair to call it a locker room, its simply too lovely for that. There is a second 'relaxation room' where you can sip tea an enjoy small bites while you wait. Delightful.

As for the massage itself, may I just say that it was the most relaxing 90 minutes of my life?? It was one of those times where time goes by much more quickly than you want. I didn't want it to end. The room has a vaulted ceiling with what look to be the original beams. It has two tables and shower heads above each for the citrus scrubs [yikes did that sound sexy...] The woman [you can ask for gender preference if you like] who worked on me - Carol, I think - was great. I was kept warm the whole time either by her hands holding the smooth warm stones or by the perfect weight of the covers over the rest of me. I felt perfectly taken care of. My 5x operated shoulders have never felt so relaxed. I walked out of there and into the ahhhhmaaaazing not-locker room [stocked with everything - and I do mean everything - you might need, right down to qtips, shave cream and disposable razors] where an out of town guest asked me what I had done and she told me I looked stoned. All of that without drugs!! The showers, walk in and large enough for a family of 5, are similarly equipped with all of the spa products to use and enjoy. Lovely. 

As an aside, I don't mean to short-change the pedi but I am a girl who has frequent pedi's, so this was less of a treat than the massage which I'm less likely to get for myself. It was pleasant, in a nice atmosphere but nothing seriously out of the ordinary. And sorry my lovely, but not worth 80+ dollars. 

There are nooks outdoors - each with lounge chairs and fireplaces - where you can relax and unwind further. Or you can have lunch there with your book - which I did. Menu, lunch, it all comes to you quickly, sweetly, happily. Makes me wish I lived there. Its quiet and lovely and is a great match to the experience itself. The staff is kind and attentive and a dot on the i of the incredible experience.

Just returned from a pre-Thanksgiving,pre-family get together where my 
Husband surprised me and  booked us into the resort for some alone birthday r&r. I can't believe our good fortune to arrive at this oasis mid week and fine a staff that doted on our every need or want. The check-in area sets the mood for what is to come...plush desk area with a fabulous fire and beverages along with an upgrade(small snafu on the part of Kayak)..during our three days at the resort we never encountered anyone who was less than a true hospitality professional. Grounds and pool area are emaculate.   the rooms. Well,let's just say the balcony,soaking tub and high end linens just start the long list of amenities. We had dinner at t.cooks ,the on site restaurant and that equaled the rest of the faculty. Top quality food and service,worth every penny or pennies!if your looking for no unpleasant surprises and spending your money at a place that really does appreciate you being there,then I would book a few nights here. Compared to other high end hotels or boutique places we've been lucky to experience Royal Palms is in our top three...ever! Oh, you won't even miss shopping  Scottsdale to hang out here all day and night.
to

I have stayed here since 1999 and I think it just gets better every time we come in to town. Service is top notch, the food is excellent and the rooms of course are beautiful with a great view. Nice quality mattresses, linens, and amenities. The service is comparable to the Beverly Hills Hotel. An example is: we asked about a restaurant and they brought reviews to us; and when we decided to dine there, they made reservations and printed a map. Everything was waiting in an envelope when we went to get our car for the evening. We are treated so well, weather we are in a smaller summer discount room or a suite in March for spring training. The employees of The Royal Palms Inn will go out of there way to assist you to the best of their ability, we did not hear "no" with out a very valid reason; and they came up with alternatives. I highly recommend this place to relax and be pampered.

Came here for a weekend getaway from LA. The grounds are really beautiful, albeit a bit rustic in comparison to some of the more typical, modern luxury hotels most people usually stay at. Stayed in a suite which was great and very spacious. The staff are all very friendly and helpful!

One star off because the breakfast at T. Cook's is very average. And because the steam room in the Spa was pretty cold. The massage I got was amazing, but when you go into a steam room and the tiles are cold and the water dripping from the condensation on the ceiling is also cold...that's not ideal.

Overall would recommend though! Just go out for breakfast. :)

Oh Royal Palms, how I love thee so!!!

We were just at RP this past weekend and thoroughly enjoyed this place.  Situated close to the Camelback mountains, when you enter through the gates you feel as if you are entering a Spanish mansion.  From the moment you pull up, the valet team are all over you making sure you and your luggage are properly taken care of.

Every single soul that I met who worked here was exceptional, courteous and went above and beyond.  I was quickly checked in and given all of the information that I needed.  Afterwards, the bell man/valet come to escort you to your room with a quick overview of the property.  After walking me to my Terrace Casita Room, he did everything from lay out my suitcase to fill my ice bucket.  The best thing about their wonderful service is that all of the tipping (except restaurant & spa) is included with the resort fee ($30 per day).  

The room (210) was marvelous!  We enjoyed the soaking tub that was so deep, I kept slipping under water =) as well as the huge shower, comfy king sized bed and our nice little patio.  We had a chance to take a swim in the pool as well and while there were several people out, it wasn't too crowded just yet.  I love their turn-down service (when do they even come in?!?), the yummy candies and bottled water they leave bedside and the concierge.  We booked last minute reservations through Mona at a swank French restaurant (separate review) and had no issues.  We were even given a complimentary glass of champagne as thanks to her sending us over. 

I genuinely loved just about everything here.  The grounds are quiet and well appointed and the hotel is close to some great shopping and fine-dining.  

If I had to fuss it would be to say that our toilet in our bathroom kept running.  After a couple of jiggles of the handle it was all fine so no real complaints there.  We also went to T. Cooks Lounge around 10pm one night but was a little disappointed that we missed the live entertainment for the night.  The food and drinks there were just okay and we ended up sending one item back (smoked brie).  The drinks were a little watery but our bartender was super nice.

I cannot wait to plan another trip here once the weather cools down a bit.  This would also be a nice place to head to once all of the kiddies are back in school.

I stayed here for a conference. My diamond stud earrings went missing from the time my husband checked out to the time the room was cleaned. (He had seen them and forgot to grab them.) Estimated time of two hours in which the earrings were left unattended.
He texted me when I was in the conference when he remembered seeing the earrings and notified security. The security person was cooperative and searched to no avail.
I sat in the lobby for the Phoenix police. I asked for a comment card. I was told a survey would be emailed to me.  No one from management met me. I am told that the employees are longstanding and have a lot to lose meaning their job if they stole the earrings. I asked if they polygraph employees. It is the police's decision apparently.
My biggest disappointment is that no one from the staff reached out. At least four employees knew of my situation, did not say my name or offer a sentence stating they were sorry about the situation. It was though I was the problem although I had not accused anyone of anything. I have to file a report for insurance. 
One star goes to the security officer. He was professional, sensitive and empathetic to my situation.

We stayed here last month and enjoyed our stay.  The room was comfortable and included a fireplace and a nice patio.  I took my yoga mat outside of the patio and did a little yoga on the lawn outside our room.  The next day I enjoyed a one-on-one yoga class in the secret garden...such a relaxing and lovely way to practice yoga.  The bed was super comfortable and the bathroom was nicely equipped too.  The Royal Palms is not my favorite Valley resort, but it is a nice escape for a boutique experience.

They Royal Palms ruined our wedding night.  We arrived at 11pm, excited for what we thought would be a luxurious, relaxing two day stay.  When we were shown to our room, we realized it was not the room we had booked two months in advance; it did not have a soaking tub, the rose-petal turndown, or its own private patio.  

Naturally, my brand-new husband and I contacted the front desk; there wasn't a manager on site.  The man we were speaking too was unprofessional, informing us the room we had booked was not available and that ours was an "upgrade".  (How he could say that when the room was lacking amenities, I don't know.)  My husband was firm and eventually they said they'd put us in the Presidential Suite, but we'd have to move out of the room the next morning.

It was getting late and we acquiesced, and by midnight were finally in another room.  Unfortunately we had lost the luxury of being able to enjoy the night and sleep in since we had to move out in the morning.  We checked out, and had to wait until 3pm until the room we'd actually ordered was unoccupied and ready.

Do not trust the Royal Palms if you want a relaxing, special occasion stay.  It swiftly earned the name "Royal Pain" for the terrible wedding night experience it gave us.

Great Weekend.  Halibut was the best meal.  If you get a mani and pedi request Kathy she is the best nail tech with AWESOME stories to keep you entertained.  

Valet and Bell hops are great.  All appt requests were met with intended time.  

Staff was great.  

The birds by the pool....not so much :)

Beautiful hotel grounds, staff were all nice & friendly. Feels like your in Spain with all the Spanish influenced architecture. The resort has lots of corner spots & little nooks with water or fire pits. The pool is heated & open 24/7. I would definitely come back...great location as well. This hotel is situated on Camelback Rd & has an awesome view of Camelback Mountain.
Had a lovely weekend stay at this place. Service was great! The Mix up bar was great! The pool was great! Well worth it and we'll be back.
Absolutely exquisite and gorgeous!  Beautiful grounds and ambiance, fabulous food and staff.  It was a wonderful evening!

i feel so cliche giving another five! we just got back from a five day stay at the Royal Palms and it was just fantastic. there were only two small gripes:

1. the little cubby hole in the shower to put your shampoo in is at an angle and everything slides out
2. there's no iPod connector in the room- a bummer since they were just remodeled

honestly, everything else was amazing. the rooms, the pool, the grounds, the spa, the food and most of all the service. the cabana boys at the pool were totally friendly day in and day out- no matter what you were asking of them or how busy they were. anything you asked was answered with a smile and "You got it!" 

and here's the kicker: tipping was all included on the front end. So they weren't even doing it to get a big tip! 

at night, the grounds are dotted with little fire pits and couches where you can sit, sip wine and chat. there are also free pilates and yoga classes, and hammocks and croquet set ups around the grounds.

we couldn't have asked for anything more. i know it's in phoenix which is not always the most exciting place, but i'm telling you, this is a very nice destination resort for a conference, wedding or just chilling with a spouse or girlfriends.

Best Hotel in the Valley... very expensive but when i have done comps it was actually cheaper then sanctuary... the staff is top notch and they enter your preferences in their computer system so when you come back they remember what you like.

Ugh! This place is magic! I went there for my birthday for a spa day and what thought would just be a 50 minute massage turned into an evening of complete bliss. I walked around the area (which is just calming and beautiful - all you hear are birds chirping and the little water falls) and had dinner and drinks at their bar. I actually think I'll try to make this a frequent place to relax. I'm only not giving it a 5 star because of their rates, I got my deal from Groupon but if it's a day of splurging I definitely definitely recommend !!
Basically amazing! The food, rooms and ambience is just fantastic! Staff is friendly and helpful. It's a must if you are visiting AZ!

When we decided to go to Phoenix for the weekend, my boyfriend and I agreed we didn't want a big time resort. We decided on Royal Palms and it did not disappoint. 
This resort just gives off that warm cozy feel...the decor, the service...we arrived late on Friday night and entering the reception area, were scented candles and a cozy fireplace. 
Our room, it was nice, spacious, great bathtub...but it felt a bit like a cave (heavy drapery and a small window)! Definitely request a room with a terrace or balcony with a view. 
The concierge, Mona, was fabulous!! She was such a help and the 3 restaurants that she suggested for us, definitely delivered!! 
The pool area was nice and the service was very accommodating and friendly. 
The spa was also very nice...small but quaint, nice. I enjoyed a massage was nice. 
The fitness area seemed very small, I didn't use the facility...Mona informed me of the canal, that was just a mile down the way that I ran to and along. 
The location was also great, it felt centrally located and easy to get around. 
I would definitely stay here again, and recommend it for a weekend getaway, a nice alternative to the 'over the top' massive resorts...
Beautiful resort with a European feel. Had one of the best massages ever at their spa. Room service was consistently delicious! Comfy beds and great location.

My wife and I were able to enjoy two nights at the Royal Palm Resort, on Tuesday and Wednesday. 

Relaxing, romantic, and secluded. The rooms are unique and intimate. If you are looking for grand spaces...it's not going to be the place for you.  If you are looking for intimacy and luxury...it's all good.

The Royal Palms is easily the most magical and memorable hotel I've stayed at, anywhere in the world. The Spanish Revival architecture, lush gardens, colorful tiles ascending the stairwells, and labyrinthine walkways combine to form a palatial, magical realism aesthetic resembling something Gabriel Garcia Marquez might have dreamt up. 

A [gothic fiction] summary of the stay:

The bellhop greets you by name. You haven't checked in to your room yet, and this is your first time staying at the hotel. "Welcome back!" they say.

You follow the warm, seductive aroma of poppies to your casita. The door is ajar. You enter and instinctively sit on the leather armchair, as though you have done so a thousand times before.

You walk to the fountain courtyard. You start to walk back to your casita, but suddenly, you're in a courtyard again. It's the same courtyard you were in a moment ago, but the fountain is gone. And the trees have moved. There is no courtyard. A grackle squawks for crumbs.

You stumble upon the pool area. You see the same guests you saw yesterday. Their smiles comfort you until you remember that you just checked in today. The guests wave at you in unison.

You wander around for awhile. You're going in circles, but the landscaping keeps changing. You hear a voice whisper "turn left." There's no right turn, and when you try to turn around, you're against a wall that wasn't there before.

You arrive home. You receive an e-mail from The Royal Palms: "We look forward to your upcoming stay!" You search for your suitcase, which you were holding a second ago. It's outside, next to the street curb. A black car pulls up. The passenger door is already open, and the scent of poppies wafts in the air. You get in, abidingly, and return to the airport. 

I may still be in a trance :)

This is the place to go for a quiet and relaxing getaway! The hotel grounds are beautiful, rustic, and romantic - you almost feel like you're in Tuscany! The service is top-notch and they treat you so well! We spent some time at the pool, where the staff never let your water get empty and passed out frozen grapes and samples of some of their signature drinks. Chelsea and Steven made sure everyone was taken care of and having a great time! The rooms were nice with had high-end products and the bed was very comfortable. Overall, the hotel is intimate and best suited for a romantic getaway.

Rooms are so beautiful and the grounds offer great romantic walks. The bed is so comfy. I wanted to take that bad boy home. Little benches and reading areas. 24/7 pool and hot tub 

Cons: 

Checkin slow waited over 10 minutes before someone even said hello. When I booked no mention of 30 a NIGHT resort fee.  Supervisor on sift could Cate less spoke with GM and she waved but ONLY after walking her through booking and proving wasn't mentioned. I would stay again on a special date but with such a high resort fee too high too stay a week for vacation.

This review is specifically for the Alvadora Spa...and even more so for Mariah who gave me the most incredible facial I have ever had in my entire life. Ladies and gents - if I were you I would definitely take advantage of the $99 summer promotion and treat yourself to a truly rejuvenating experience. I've had a number of facials in my life but I've never had an aesthetician actually stay in the room while the masks were drying and give upper back, cranial, arm and hand massages nor have I ever had luxuriously warm rehydrating hand mitts during the process of a facial. My skin has a new, refreshed glow to boot. This is the pinnacle of facials - I will never go anywhere else!

Wow.  What a beautiful oasis.  The property and buildings are quite unique with numerous outdoor and indoor fireplaces they keep lit, pools, fountains, walkways, outdoor socializing and eating areas, etc.  Perfect for a romantic getaway or a wedding.  

The rooms are also very impressive with deluxe bedding mattresses- not like your typical Marriott or Hilton beds but much nicer.  Extremely supportive but also comfortable.  Large tub with separate shower.  

The service was also impeccable.

This might very well be my favorite resort in the whole land.  

When you first turn onto the driveway lined with tall palm trees, approaching the Royal Palms serene entrance with the mountains looming in the background, you realize that this isn't any ordinary place to stay. Instantaneously, bags were retrieved from the vehicle and you're inside and helped in a jiffy. Yes, you're in Phoenix, yet somehow you're worlds away from it all. 

The room was serene and beautiful. The color scheme and accents had a Mediterranean influence, exotic yet familiar and calming. The room is spacious. The bed is comfortable. The bathroom is exquisite. A separate shower with perfect water pressure. A separate toilet. And a most excellent deep-soaking bathtub. And I stayed in an estate room. I can't imagine how glorious the estate suites, villas, or casitas are. 

The property itself is magnificent. The main courtyard with its center fountain, its Mediterranean style accented by palm trees and flowers and the mountains in the background is stunning. The grounds are lush and green and there are so many built in tranquil spots, both hidden and unhidden, where you can relax. The main pool is large, with adequate and comfortable seating. There isn't a spot within the Royal Palms that isn't scenic or relaxing. 

Service is top-notch. You get the sense that they will do anything to make your stay more comfortable. 

And if you really did not want to leave the property - no one would fault you for this - there is an amazing on site restaurant, T. Cook's. One of the best white-cloth dinners I've had in recent memory was at T. Cook's. Do you miss the Duck a L'Orange, it is ridiculously tasty. 

There are only good and great things to say about the Royal Palms. It is always considered one of the best in the area, if not the country. I can't argue with that. This place is absolutely amazing. If you can't manage to relax and unwind here, there is something seriously wrong with you :)

My 2 star rating is considering that this is a 5 star hotel and should be held to high standards. There are many amazing things about the hotel, the grounds are amazing and the staff is good.  A few issues:
1) While at the pool for over 3 hours I was never approached by the wait staff.  There was a girl walking around but she avoided me completely.
2) The parking garage looks like and smells like a dump.  A 5 star hotel should keep up all areas where guest view.  They store old furnishings down there and there is a bad sewage smell.
3) They charge 20 dollars to park your car. This just seems like greed considering you are already paying upwards of 500 for the room, 30 resort fee not to mention room service, t-cooks spa, do you really need an additional 20 to park your car in a smelly garage?
Fix these issues and I will up my rating.

The resort is absolutely breathtaking, quiet and relaxing. The pool is gorgeous, the rooms clean, delicious food, and staff that went above and beyond to help us enjoy our stay. We can not wait to get back here.

This review is for the lounge that is part of this gorgeous hotel that boasts outstanding vistas along with a lush tropical feel to it.  My wife wanted to check this place out for happy hour. I'm glad we did; The food is excellent. They have $2 steak tacos on Tuesdays. Although they are relatively tiny, they were very tasty. We had the short rib flat bread for $7. Which is not what you are thinking when you hear the word flat bread. It's more like a tortilla in which you dish in the short rib meat (no bones) and lather it with this heavenly goat cheese. I could have eat that cheese all night. In addition, we had the pretzel bread bites that came with dipping cheese. The first few pretzels I dipped with the cheese but then I realized that I still had goat cheese left. Think of a bagel lathered with cream cheese. That's what I did with the goat cheese and pretzel bread. Our total tab came to $18 (included one soda) before tip.

Needless to say, this place is very intimate and classy and very affordable for the regular folks.  And I might add that all of the employees are professional and helpful.

I've been in many presidential suites, few better than the one here.
Everything is superb.
Attention to detail, focused and sharp.
And the room itself?
Romantic with it's outdoor showers, making you feel almost naughty when showering.
And room service?
I enjoyed the eggs benedict, although it was somewhat cold.

Too bad I onlly have until till two o'clock to get this room cleaned and ready for shift manager inspection.

Bought a groupon and joined friends for a day.  Wouldnt say the facial was worth 130 which included tip (20%).  Dont like suggestive selling, and the front desk was a bit disorganized.  Spa was mediocre at best- small and on top if that the sauna was out of order.  Property is nice and service by the pool was good.  Drinks weak and food subpar.  Would not do it again as the experience overall was a decent 2 star out of 5.

The Royal Palms is royalty in the resort spotlight!  Only a few years ago, this beautiful location was slowly deteriorating into a mess of chipped paint, ancient tiles, and broken fountains.  With the refurbishment of the past few years, the Royal Palms has sprung up as though from a fountain of youth, while still keeping its wonderful, old-school charm.  
If you decide to stay, be warned that prices are over two times the price in the winter.  If you want to catch a break, go during the heat of the summer.  The rooms are frosty cool, and the gigantic showers and tubs are perfect for two!  Each casita was designed by a different interior decorator, and the main buildings are beautiful as well.
The crowning jewel of the Royal Palms is the SPA.  Oh my.  This place is absolutely luscious!  Be prepared for a pricey, but totally worth it, experience.  My husband and I had several treatments one weekend and all were performed in the duet room, which has soaring wood beamed ceilings, a fireplace, and a totally private outdoor shower with a waterfall spigot.  Our masseuses were very professional and discreet, and the entire experience left us both relaxed and happy.
In the words of Ferris Bueller:  If you have the means, I seriously recommend it.

This was our first visit to this resort and upon arrival, we were greeted by super friendly guys at valet (which is complimentary for the entire stay). We got a deal on travel zoo for a one night stay in a casita, two cocktails, a $25 food credit and and $50 spa credit. 
The resort grounds are truly beautiful. You almost forget you're in Phoenix; all the plants and flowers are so lush and green. The room was cozy with a large 4 poster bed. The room had a Kuerig machine which was nice to have, even though we didn't get a chance to use it. The shower was large and the room was really clean. 
The resort is a destination earth property and very Eco conscious which I liked. The resort also includes a daily resort fee so that way you don't feel obligated to tip at every turn.  All the staff were extremely polite. 
The only issues I had was with the spa and room service. The $50 spa credit could only be used on a 50 minute service. I really wanted a pedicure and we were gonna pay out of pocket for a second pedicure so we could do it like a couples treatment but it wasn't an option. Also, it was 40+ for breakfast for the equivalent of a Denny's grand slam breakfast and it didn't come with any juice or anything just water.
 The resort fee does allow you access to the fitness center, pool, hot tub and into the spa to use the showers and eucalyptus steam room which was so refreshing and relaxing.

An oasis in the desert. You are treated wonderfully from the minute you drive up. The staff totally caters to your needs to provide a comfortable stay. Sitting by the pool they brought ice water without being requested but they'll also bring other drinks. I love the mature landscape and all of the different places to sit and relax outside. The inside could use a little remodel. The beds are comfortable and the A/C is cold and quiet. We slept well and enjoyed our time there.

I'm a sucker for good service and this is tops! 

Everyone, bellman, valet, pool guy, front desk, housekeeping. I think really good service people should anticipate what you want, so that you don't have to ask and they do a great job here.   I left the do not disturb sign up while we went to lunch and the desk left us a message to ask if we still wanted our room cleaned, and it was cleaned spotless in the hour and a half we were at the pool.  The pool people are great, make sure you have ice water filled (it's the desert you need to stay hydrated), will move umbrellas for you, whatevs.   The pool is a bit small but it's really relaxing.  They play this sorta flamenco guitar music everywhere which could be annoying to some, but i think it's sorta funny cause I had it in my head all week.   The grounds are beautiful, relaxing, and quiet.  
 The valets were great, and I love that they seemed so genuinely appreciative for tips, and not like they were expecting them at all.  There is a  25 dollars a night resort fee that's includes some tips, grounds fee, valet whatever, but I still feel like I have to tip that's just me.  House keeping was great too, the kept not taking our tips and we'd have to chase them down and tip them.   As for T. Cooks I only had breakfast here which was good nothing to amazing but good solid and well priced 12-14 dollars.  The lobby has  this really good FREE arnold palmer that they put grenadine in and the ice tea has a bit of orange in it.  It's like crack.  

I guess the minus would be the pool being small, and the steam room smelled a little funky.

What a gem
Staff was amazing and skilled in the fine art of customer service. My wife and I are locals that wanted a staycation sans kids and to celebrate my wifes bday. I booked on Hotels.com and called the resort to confirm. Nina was awesome and asked if we were celebrating a special occasion. Some reviaewers mentioned the snooty attitudes of the valet staff and tcooksstaff. We had no such issues at all. They were all wonderful and if you tried to tip valet they reminded you about the resort fee an no tip policy. After a pleasant happy hour at t cooks with excellent service we retired to our room only to discover a clean room and chocolates for my wife. 
We will be coming back.

The best and most intimate resort in Phoenix. Stayed here for my wedding night so of course this is a special place fore but believe me we had many places to choose from. The rooms are beautiful, grounds are intimate and well kept and the staff will go above and beyond to meet your needs. I have not gone to the spa personally yet, but purchased a massage for my mom for Mother's Day and she loved it.

The experience lives up to the expectation set in its name. I was lucky enough to have my wedding at the Royal Palms and must say that the experience from start to finish was spectacular. Set against the backdrop of Camelback Mountain, the setting is simply stunning. We had our wedding reception in the Estrella Room with the cocktail hour in the courtyard in front of the room. 

Before getting married here, I was told by anyone I spoke to that the wedding food is by far the best they've ever had anywhere else. I completely agree with this statement. The food is a culinary masterpiece. It doesn't taste like your typical catered food. It tastes like the food they serve in T Cooks, if not better! Everything you eat, down to the bread and pesto dip is extraordinary.  

The service is about as extraordinary as the food. I worked with Suzanne who was extremely helpful from start to finish. Each bride and groom gets a "shadow" for the wedding day. Our shadow was the fabulous Christy and followed us around while we took pictures and throughout the whole night and made sure we had cocktails, food and any other help throughout the night. She even helped me in the bathroom with my large wedding dress! I can't say enough about Christy and how helpful she was throughout the night. She was calm, comforting and helpful throughout the whole night. 

I will end this review by saying that "you get what you pay for" and while the Royal Palms is on the pricier end, it's worth every penny and they make sure they work for their money. Everyone is kind and helpful and I couldn't imagine getting married anywhere else.

Besides the wedding experience, I was also lucky enough to stay at the Royal Palms the night before and the night of the wedding. I highly recommend staying in the Valencia Casita #125. It's got an adorable courtyard, little sitting area, a small kitchen and a nicely sized bedroom. The rooms are intimate and have a lot of character. The grounds are extremely relaxing and lovely to just walk around and take in. 

I have also been a guest at their spa and must say that it's a relaxing and luxurious experience! The staff is friendly, the amenities are very nice and everything is completely relaxing.

This is my second time at scottsdale. This time I stay with Royal Palms Resort for couple night. I love this Hotel Coz they have a Nice Restaurant ,Nice Spa ,Nice swimming pool open 24hr and also really Nice service. This place it's not too far from big shopping Mall in town. I really wanna recommend for a tourist if you looking for Nice Hotel to stay. let's thinking about this. Enjoy
Spent 4 days at the resort. Very relaxing. Great food. Everyone friendly.  Very nice clean rooms.  Easy checking.  Housekeeping was great.  Lobby was clean. Will return if in AZ again.

This is a beautiful, secluded, intimate resort, timeless but cozy, packed full of charm and old European sophistication.  One of the most romantic get aways in Phoenix.   Great food and a quite sanctuary that is conveniently located!  Can't go wrong, whether it is a romantic dinner or a weekend retreat!

One of the best resorts around.  Romantic, hidden and tucked away.  Staff is very accomodating and the casitas are spaced far away enough from each other that the patios do feel really private.  Depending on the time of year, you can get a decent price on a room.  The pool area is smallish compared to newer resorts but have been nicely rennovated.

I loved this spa. I really like their private line of grooming products. My massage was great and very relaxing. I truly like their adjustable massage tables. I did not care for how small the lockers area was but likely not an issue on a slow day. Pool area was nice but didnt like that they added service charge on my drink ticket as I almost tipped twice. Overall I eould go back but Montelucia around the corner would get my $ first.

I stayed at the Royal Palms for one night (was supposed to stay 5). The property itself was beautiful. Decorated nicely for Christmas. The staff (valet Brandon and front desk clerk) were excellent - very professional and kind. Both gave a nice overview of the property and amenities. The room itself, however,  felt worn out. The carpet was in bad shape. The bed was too high to climb into, the bathtub was odd (also couldn't get into that) and you have to consider all of the extra charges. All in all I spent $350 for one night's stay (you are charged if you leave early). The property is iconic though, the staff was nice and the grounds were beautiful.

Great resort in many ways. Be careful with the rooms. We had a "designer casita" which was less than a Motel Six" room in many ways. Our kids got a wonderful room for less money. Management really doesn't care what you think. Because it is an old resort there are many, many rooms from awful to wonderful. No way to tell what you might get.

I would have given this place 4 stars over three except for one thing: The walls and floors of this place are too thin, and you can hear your neighbors big time. At 4am, the guy above me was pacing and pacing, and I could clearly hear this guy walking around (like I was living in a New York City Apartment).  After this guy finally fell asleep, around 4:30am, these two women in the adjoining room, and I could totally hear them. They weren't screaming or being overly loud; they were just having a normal volume conversation. I had to put my ear plugs in to go back to sleep.

Other than that, it's a very nice resort with a great grounds and room. The restaurant (which I did not go to) is T. Cook's, which is one of the best restaurants in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area by reputation.  Other than the noise thing, I had a very nice stay here.

This resort is beautiful.  I had the best massage I've ever experience by Bri.  She was so professional and I will definitely go back to see her.  Steven was our server at the pool and was also excellent.  He had a great sense of humor and make awesome menu suggestions.  The whole day was a delightful experience.

What an amazing place!!  I had an incredibly enjoyable time staying at the Royal Palms Resort, and recommend it highly.  So many excellent points:  absolutely gorgeous accommodations, polite and helpful staff, excellent restaurant (breakfast/ brunch outside, with a delicious cup of coffee, is a must), a great spa, and a relaxing atmosphere.  My boyfriend and I stayed here for a conference in late October, which is a great season in Arizona.  Our stay was a pleasure from beginning to end.  The resort is well-suited for special occasions (there was a wedding reception and an outdoor conference dinner during our stay).  Our room was very comfortable, with excellent set-up and a great view of the mountains from the balcony.  The resort includes a pool, a small gym, several lounge areas with firepits and fireplaces, and the wonderful Alvadora spa (with massages, facials, outdoor-facing showers, and shaded lounge areas to your heart's content).  There are several mountain trails a short walk/ drive away from the resort, and downtown Scottsdale is 10-15 minutes away by car.  In all, a beautiful place for a special occasion!

This resort is beautiful and has that romantic feel to it. The beautiful mountains, palm trees, nice lighting, and wonderful architecture on the grounds makes for a magical stay.

The rooms are nice and feel like a fancy house. You feel like you are in an expensive home rather than a resort room. Also when you walk out everything is so beautiful and doesn't have a typical resort feel. The vibes you feel here are very good and cozy.

The pool area is very nice, this is a place that doesn't cater to kids. It's very adult oriented which is a great thing since often resorts can be too wild with kids.

This is a beautiful place that you should check out if you want something different from a hotel or want a more intimate resort. They have that magic here!

Beautiful grounds, great rooms and the restaurant is excellent!!! It's our favorite place for brunch. The room we stayed at was great and the bed was so damn comfortable that  we woke up in the middle of the night to comment on how comfortable the bed was!!

The spa was OK, unfortunately my therapist kept talking and talking and talking and I was a wuss (yeah, I know...) and didn't told him to please just....shut up! 
The pool area is tiny, so if you're interested in more of a pool scene, this is not the place.

4.5 but I'll round up because of the best bed ever!!

The Royal Palms Has Lost Its Sparkle :(  I am a local and hold a Spa membership and also frequent T. Cooks and The Mix Up Bar. The last few visits have been disappointing to say the least. Most recently I had a dispute with the billing department regarding the billing of my monthly membership fees. After first trying to reach the Spa directly with no avail. I was caught up in the voicemail system never being able to connect to the spa to speak to someone. I then called the front desk , where I eventually spoke to the Guest Services Manager, Nate. I explained to him the issue and immediately he was attentive and accommodating. He went far beyond the call of customer service and resolved the issue , personally with professionalism and genuine care and concern. I am really writing this review for Nate. He is a credit to The Royal Palms and deserves recognition for his service. Thanks Again Nate:) Your a Rockstar ***

love, love, love. From the moment we got out of our car - the entire staff was amazing. The pool side bar and staff are fantastic, they went way out of their way to make sure we were not sunburned - drinks were perfect. The spa treatments are top shelf and the employees at the spa were kind and warm.

This review is for the bar only - it's our 'go-to' place to unwind on any given night... 

Tonight happened to be a rare Friday evening where my fiance and I were ready to get our swig on. Royal Palms bar took good care of us... fantastic bartenders, fun company on either side of us, great wine, delicious food (especially the bread with pesto sauce), and Dwight on the piano with a vocalist.  Jared had a simple turkey sandwich with some sort of salami and a side of salad.  I went with the bronzini fish that was served with some vegetables - different than what I expected but very good.  In the past, I've gone with their burger and it's ahhhmazing!  

One of these days we will actually spend the night at the Royal Palms, but until then, it's a treat to just go for several drinks, a meal, a cup of coffee, and a slow drive home.

Sadly, the Royal Palms has all the beauty and bones to be a five star resort, but none of the customer service or special touches that make it so. We stayed for three nights during a November weekend as part of a wedding block and were just so disappointed by the overall feel of the place with one bigger problem that was just not met with any amount of concern from the management. Our biggest specific concern was that the heating/cooling system in our room did not work for the majority of our stay and the first night we slept/didn't sleep in an 80+ degree room with hot air uncontrollably blowing all night long, where you cannot open a single window to the cool November air. It seemed like such a tease to have cool air outside! We discussed with another wedding group member that she had the same exact problem, so clearly this was not an isolated problem. We brought it up to management three separate times and were met with neither a solution or a fair explanation. Ultimately we felt that we were not fairly compensated for completely losing out an entire nights comfort in a not inexpensive hotel room. This is not a complaint about the softness of the linens or the light fixtures in the rooms we're talking about. This is basic creature comforts. You can usually get working air conditioning in the Motel 6. I found this unacceptable and completely not on par with a five star hotel experience, let alone a three star hotel experience. There were smaller things that were noted by us that we felt were just a bit "odd" about the rooms-very dark lighting/inadequate if you are a woman trying to put on makeup or get ready for an event, dark carpeting, very thin walls/can hear neighbors making even quiet noises, and a sewage-y smell from our bathroom every once in awhile. 
I understand that this hotel recently underwent ownership change/management change under Hyatt hotels, and I am not sure if this is to account for the lack of attention to detail and large problems left unsettled. I also understand that this property originates from a historic citrus plantation, and that is cool and all, but the rooms have to stay up to the 21st century hotel standards if you are advertising it as such. I'm not sure which of these reasons or if either of them are to explain anything that occurred during our stay.
The pluses of this hotel are the stunning, well maintained grounds, as well as the pool area and the service at the pool area, and the Mix Up Bar, which I should probably write a separate review for because it was so good. 
Not even taking into account other family members even bigger problems, and the fact that I just don't have a whole lot of reason to return to Phoenix any time soon, I would definitely not stay here again or recommend it to anyone else looking for a five star hotel experience.

This is beyond the most incredible resort I have ever stayed at. Can't wait to come back! I went here for a quick staycation over the weekend for my anniversary and I couldn't ask for anything more special. The beauty of the resort and the service I received from every single staff member was Incredible! 

Check in is normally at 4pm but I called that morning and the staff was very kind over the phone and found an available room so we were able to check-in at 12pm. All parking is valet so you pull up, and the bell hops will help unload your car and direct you to check in desk. The staff was so nice checking us in and then even greeted us with a fresh glass of champagne. Our bell hop walked us to our room and even explained a little history about the resort. Like it used to be a home in 1922. 

The rooms are large and beautiful. We had a huge soaker tub and a large double shower head walk in shower. We also had a free Keurig in the room and a private patio. My favorite part was the bed! It was so fluffy and felt like a cloud! Best sleep of my life! They do a turn down service at night so they come in and turn down bed sheets, give chocolates, and close the curtains so your ready for bed. We received a gift of chocolate covered strawberries and champagne for our anniversary when we got back to the room. Such a romantic evening. 

This is a very beautiful historic Spanish style resort so very little kids which is nice for a special romantic occasion. There is multiple courtyards that all look different so it's gorgeous to just walk all the pathways and explore. Beautiful lit up at night. There is benches, tables, games, waterfalls, and fruit trees all over the property. Great large pool and jacuzzi which is open 24-7 so you can go anytime at night when it's less busy. They do have a great poolside bar and it's pretty packed during the day. 

Check-out was at 12pm but they are very accommodating so just a quick call down to front office they let us know we can check out at 1pm which allowed us more time to relax in the morning. We ordered breakfast in bed of pancakes and a fried egg sandwich which were both amazing! 

Overall everything from start to finish was amazing. Such a beautiful resort to stay at for a romantic evening and the staff made our stay so special. I'm very excited to come back, if not sooner, at least for our anniversary next year. Next time I want to try the famous T Cooks restaurant on property that I herd great things from. 

Thank you Hyatt and royal palms for making our anniversary so special!

Such a beautiful resort! My parents stayed here over the weekend so we popped over a few times to visit them & check it out. The staff were friendly & very helpful when we had any questions. The rooms are beautiful & pretty spacious. The bathroom is stocked with great products from their spa.

The pool isn't large like other resorts in the area, but it's extremely relaxing & peaceful.

Thanks to my parents, we'll be back to try T. Cook's restaurant soon!

What a treat!

This beautiful resort and spa sits just below Camelback Mountain in Scottsdale. The setting is a tranquil and serene compound of architectural excellence that combines Spanish colonial, hacienda and Mediterranean effects, lush gardens, fountains and courtyards. The accommodations are rustically elegant but well appointed with features such as a nice widescreen TV, fast in-room wifi, a fireplace, a Keurig coffee maker and a sitting area in the patio just outside the room. I can't comment on the value as a friend paid for it. But even if it was $500/night, it would still be worth the splurge. The staff is very friendly and helpful without being over bearing. I didn't take advantage of the spa or swimming pool but if you just want to spend a couple of days being pampered and relaxing with great views of Camelback, this is your place.

This resort is all about service...they really tske care of you! The property itself has such deep history, read the coffee table book about the history of the resort. The breakfast was amazing and so was our dinner at T.Cooks! Do you want to wind down? Just off busy bustling Camelback, you can't help but wind down and relax. Try the Spa as they do it better than most! I recommend this resort!

This was our 7 year wedding anniversary and we had  very high hopes of having a wonderful time. The grounds themselves are gorgeous, and the hotel is kept up very well.

The problem lied in the staff. When we came back from breakfast, our room was being cleaned with the French doors propped open by the housekeeper's cleaning cart. There is a specific sign that says to please not leave the doors open because bugs get in, and indeed they did as we had both dead and live bugs including a baby lizard!

While at the pool, my husband went up to ask for our tab as we wanted to leave, and the server was apparently having a terrible day. He lit up my husband about what a terribly run place this bar is, and how they were out of everything, computers down, & a litany of profanity in expressing his dismay at having to work there! We could not believe this, and were taken aback.

We asked that are covers be turned down on our final evening there, as there were yellow stains on the comforter. While it seems that the sheets were changed, the same yellow stains were on the comforter after they cleaned the room.

There were other issues, I won't bore you with the details, we did make the front desk aware of the entire list and she did deduct $75 off of our stay of 3 nights, but that didn't make up for the ridiculous charges and abuse we endured while being there. The parking charge of $15 per day is also absurd, especially since we took other means of transportation everywhere we went during our stay.

While the grounds are beautiful, I would appreciate going to a place that is was not as unprofessional as they were here, including some snide remarks made by the valets, in an attempt to be funny. 

I fully expected management to call me the next day after my list of gripes, however our business was apparently not important enough for them to do so. I also suspect that the front desk person did not even convey these to management, which we did ask to speak to before we left, but were told she was not in.

There are plenty of other gorgeous resorts in Paradise Valley and Scottsdale who will receive our business in the future.

Chose to stay here for our staycation/mini moon this past weekend and boy was it the best decision ever! From the moment we reached the premise we were met with top notch service, we made our way to check in and we're greeted with friendly warm faces and 2 glasses of champagne, we were then taken to our upgraded room where then sent up a bottle of champagne and the most delectable chocolate covered strawberries!! All in all we can't wait to spend our yearly anniversaries at this beautiful and amazing hotel!!

My mom and I decided to stay here for a mom and daughter weekend for my 30th birthday. The grounds are very pretty.

When we got to our room since it was later we decided to watch a movie but the remote wasn't working so we called the front desk to see if we could get some help. 30 minutes went by and no had shown up so we called again and the girl claimed she had no idea about it and we waited another 30 minutes for someone to come and push a button to reconnect the remote. 

The next day we had a spa day planned and first I had a facial.. The girl I had doing mine was rather snotty about my normal routine and pushed me to change the things I did in my every day life bc my face was too dry (keep in mind I had a dermatologist appt the next day and they told me my face was fine).. So not a fun experience with the facial. Than I had a body scrub which was super nice and a massage from the same girl and she was great! 

Than I had a blow dry and the woman was so rough on my head it almost made me cry when she shampooed my head. She almost drenched my face and blamed the sprayer than she put me under a dryer so my hair would dry faster because she had broken her arm and still couldn't use it very well and she accepted taking another client in between to cut his hair. Not okay!! Than when she went to go blow dry my hair she kept pointing the hair dryer on my scalp burning me! And she did a zig zag part (very 90s and out of date) claiming it was her signature as well as curling my ends making me look like a 10 year old! 

Overall I'd say the whole spa experience really was not worth it. It did not have very many other amenities beside the services you were get like other spas and all the services provided were not the greatest! 

Very disappointed!
Absolutely breathtaking resort and very romantic. This place has live music during hh and their hh menu is delicious along with their restaurant as well.
Nice grounds, adequate room.   Very expensive.  Good bar.   Not sure its worth the money as there are equally fine options for less money in the vicinity.

This is one of my favorite places to stay at!  My family and I stayed here for a weekend a while back and we all had a great time.  Everyone was so friendly and went out of their way to make our stay as comfortable as possible.  The property is beautiful and the gardens are great for a stroll.  We loved the fantastic view of Camelback mountain from their heated pool.  Our room was spacious and clean.  I can't wait to come back to this place the next time I'm in Scotsdale.

I have stayed in a lot of the best hotels in Phoenix and I am more neutral on the Royal Palms more because I think they do some things well like the check-in process and other things are a bit substandard like the Mix-Up Bar which feels dark and too sleepy when compared to places like the Thirsty Camel at the Phoenician.  We had one drink and then moved on. 

My wife felt that the spa could use some extra touches like razors, hair products, lotion, etc.  She felt that it lacked the personal things one would expect from a high end resort.  She did however like the massage and was pleased there.

Visually, the grounds are beautiful and there is a lot of history.  The room was nice and well put together.  

The worst part of this hotel was the late night room service.  It's bad enough that they have 4 menu items but the night clerk was woefully undertrained in Customer Service.  No follow up, rude and in general seemed "put out," when she called to confirm the order.

To the credit of the resort, they comped the food.  They did double charge us for the room which is a human error and they acknowledged the accounting was done incorrectly.  They didn't correct the charges until 10 days later.  

I just felt that the trip in general was incomplete and I had high expectations for this hotel.

I stopped in on one of my recent resort pool hops and might have found my new go to pool. The pool is small and crowded, but the large blue chair towels, poured water in a large container and service made up for it. I was greeted as I entered the pool area and treated kindly through out my stay. I ate a chicken quesadilla at the bar that was "to die for". Yum that was good! I ate the whole thing, even in my bikini. I ordered a long island iced tea, but was given a Mai tai, with an apology and "I'll make you a long island iced tea after you finish that, if you want" from the bar tender. 

I paid my bill and included a tip, but  it wasn't until after wards that I noticed the tip was already included. Nothing was said to me so I guess they figured I wanted to tip twice...hmmm.

Beginning NOW! They have a live Jazz Band on the courtyard playing that is out of this world great. Steven P is the vocalist-Producer-songwriter that is there now. Nice evenings there on Thursday! 
Nice staff and great fun. Sexy surroundings.

This place is gorgeous.  I haven't stayed in the rooms, but have dined in T. Cooks many times and have attended several functions in the banquet rooms.  It's always a great experience.

From the moment you arrive at Valet to the end of your event, the customer service here is awesome.  The banquet staff always goes over and above to make sure you're well taken care of.  At one particular breakfast meeting there wasn't any ice water available in the pre-breakfast area.  Instead of telling me "there's water inside", they went in and got a fresh glass for me.  At another meeting, I asked for a Lime for a Diet Coke I was drinking....they walked to the bar inside the building to slice up a fresh Lime for me, very cool.

Whenever there's an event here, we try our best to attend because we know it will be over the top.

Return Factor - 90%

All I can say is... when I die, I hope Heaven is the Royal Palms with endless amounts of Malibu Rum and trips to the Alvadora Spa :)

Their spa is by far the best in the metro-Phoenix area. Attendants and masseuses give five-star service is, time and time again, the single best hour of my life when I get to splurge and visit them. But worth every bloody penny!

The grounds are pristine and an oasis in the Phoenix desertopia. Secluded south of the Camelback Mountains, you'd be amazed at how removed you are from the 3+ million people in the area. It's just that fabulous. 

The staff and valets are always accommodating and rarely have I ever saw or heard them get snooty as a few have complained about. 

The pool and bar is a must visit :) Especially during the eight months of summer in the Valley. The only downer... sometimes they just don't have enough loungers. But they quickly remedy that upon request.

First of all let me preface this by saying we have eaten here before for breakfast and it was one of the best breakfast we ever had!

So for my mom's 90th birthday, I thought this would be the ideal place to take her for a very special dinner.  Although the setting and the service was excellent, the food was a big let down.  I had the bison and it showed up absolutely stone cold. The reason I didn't send it back was that I didn't want to spoil my mom's dinner because I'm  sitting there without any food.   We all know how uncomfortable that can be!  And I found out later that both my mom and better half thought their fish had way too much salt on it.  

the only reason I didn't give them one star is due to the beautiful setting and staff friendliness.

I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!! We had gone for our wedding anniversary, and I had booked the room through one of those travel websites, and if you do that regularly you now that your room is going to be just a room nothing special.  So as we are checking in to the hotel, the front desk clerk informs us that our room isn't ready, and that we had been upgraded to casita. I knew from our last stay here those rooms aren't cheap, but when he said that I was jumping for joy inside!

The room was sooooo wonderful we didn't want to leave the next day!

When I think Royal Palms, I think romantic getaway. A quaint yet exquisite resort, the Royal Palms was built in 1929 to emulate a colonial Spanish retreat. Colonial as in when the Spaniards were conquering the New World.  All of the historical details are presented on a frescoed wall in one of the courtyards.  

We had heard some great things about J Cook's and decided to spend a leisurely Sunday morning dining on the patio. If you're looking to be treated like royalty, you want to dine here

I enjoyed exploring the hotel after a luxe breakfast at J.Cooks.  The staff are incredibly accomodating.  What an ideal location for an intimate stay-cation!  It's a nice place to go to grab some drinks and appetizers, I will definitely be back to see what more the resort has to offer!

An ultra high end resort perfect for a weekend escape.

The more we travel, especially for leisure, the more my wife and I gravitate toward smaller, more intimate and unique properties and the Royal Palms was exactly what we were hoping for.

We booked a "designer casita" which featured a comfy 4-poster bed, beautiful gas fireplace (turns on with a remote), large bathroom with a massive walk-in shower, a totally private walled courtyard in back and two large wing chairs.  Normally a fireplace wouldn't make much sense in warm and sunny AZ but we were unlucky to have two solid days of rain during our late February visit so the cozy fireplace was on a lot-not for heat, but ambience.

While we weren't able to enjoy lounging by the pool, we did spent some time exercising in the modest fitness center (mostly tread mills with a few free weights and a couple of weight machines) and even sat in the bubbling outdoor hot tub in the light rain. One afternoon we had a drink in the cozy hotel bar as well which was a nice relaxing spot.

Besides the very beautiful grounds featuring artful touches throughout, one of the standout features of this property is the strong service culture.  

Parking is Valet only but we never waited more than a minute for our car and there was always plenty of cheerful staff waiting to retrieve the car. Another plus is that tipping is ALREADY INCLUDED in the $31 daily resort fee so no need to travel with a pocketful of ones.  In addition our greeting at checkin was fast, efficient and friendly and we even were given a glass of sparkling wine.  One of the bellmen/valet took us on a brief walking tour of the compact property before guiding us to our nearby room.

While I wish we could have spent some time soaking up the sunshine, our visit at Royal Palms was restful, quiet and peaceful at this outstanding property.

Can't wait to return but hoping for better weather!

Royal Palms - such memories!  My wedding reception was at Royal Palms almost 10 years ago...if I could have Yelped then it would have definitely been 5 Stars.  Have stayed many times over the years and have always enjoyed returning to this special place...I would classify all as 4-5 star caliber visits.  The property remains beautiful and the location can't be beat.  Most recently returned for my wife's birthday this past weekend.  It was once again a terrific weekend, but there's clearly room for improvement.

Pro:
1. Beautiful property - perfect location
2. Great room (designer casita #118)
3. Good service
4. "Surprise" birthday dessert in room was a nice touch

Con:
1. Time to jazz up the pool area: one poor server running around like a chicken sans head does not make for a relaxing environment...and the little shack of a bar does not exude opulence.  Try to be more like a miniature version of the Scottsdale Four Seasons Pool area.
2. T'Cookes has not recaptured it's mojo from the glory years gone by - good service and food, but it used to be head and shoulders above typical resort fare.  (this could be another review if I had time).  
3. They ran out of souvineer coffee mugs - this in and of itself is no big deal, in fact they gave us a token discount on a set removed from a room.  This would have been much more appreciated if we didn't find coffee residue in the mugs when we got home.  Not the end of the world, but annoying nevertheless.  
4. $25 "Resort Fee" is irritating.  These nickel-dime charges and fees everywhere you turn these days are really getting out-of-control.  I'd rather pay the advertised price and take care of my own tips and such.  

Overall, I'd say 3.5...rounding down in this case.

**************************
8/24: Updating from original 3 star level.  After reflecting on all the hapiness that Royal Palms has brought into my life, I just can't leave this as 3 stars.  The place deserves four...kind of like a lifetime achievement award.  I wrote the original review the day after consuming 4 lemon drops by the RP pool, a Boodles martini and an Anchor Steam at the Jade bar, wine and Irish Coffee at dinner at T'Cooks, a bottle of Champagne in the room, and a bloody mary and another anchor steam at brunch the next morning at Dick's Hideaway.  My liver may have weighed in with 3 stars, but the resort really deserves 4.

We just came back to NY after a stay at the resort. At first when we booked the resort, we had high expectations and it looked wonderful from the website photos.  When we checked in on 10/31/17 in the evening, the front desk alerted us that they were going to give us a new room because the original one was near a high traffic area.  We were fine with that, when we arrived to the new room and realized that our originally requested mini-fridge was nowhere to be found, we called the desk and the gentleman said that it is underneath the TV, which was a mini-bar.  They saw it was their mistake and had maintainence bring it over from the original room.  We also noticed that a hair dryer was missing, they promised and agreed to bring one over and none was brought over in the five days we were here.  I eventually caught a head cold on my final day of our stay. Not to mention, the room was musty, dark, and had a odor.  This property needs a major uplift and overhaul.  I would not stay here again when we come back out to Arizona in the summer.

This is one of my favorite resorts.  It's a hidden gem and you could literally drive right by it and miss out on amazing experience.

If you're like me and love the Spanish style look with red-tiled roofs, outdoor fireplaces, lime-washed stucco walls, ancient pavers and antique fountains with a touch of Old World decor...I know a mouthful... you need to come here.

Upscale clientele and an amazing place for a wedding, honeymoon or romantic getaway the Royal Palms Resort resonates the epitome of historic charm and class that can only be appreciated by old school Phoenicians and snowbirds.

As soon as you drive by the iron gates a gorgeous fountain and brick courtyard welcomes you into an old dreamy Mexican style hacienda.  Adorned with original works of art, European and Mexican finishes, warm terra cotta colors and Spanish accents this 1920s boutique hotel is casual and offers a walk back in time.

My husband and I love coming here for dinner at TJ Cooks restaurant. I promise you will enjoy amazing dishes like pork tenderloin, butternut squash ravioli, Chilean sea bass, grilled lamb...duck...and the service? First class of course.  Our date nights always included a cocktail in the lounge-a dark low-ceiling cozy place with little niches and rooms to sit by the fire and listen to live piano music.

I love this place so much-it will always be favorite first stop when in Phoenix. Don't miss!

I am currently still at the Royal Palms so please stay tuned for any updates both here and on Tripadvisor/Google. 

We booked a 5 night stay for our Babymoon. I emailed prior to coming for a Casita close to the pool and also asked if the pool was cleaned often. I was assured both were true. We also asked for early check in.

Upon arrival we were forced to wait for a check in...it was fine until we realized that my 8month body would have to be so far from the pool - that request was not met.

Every day we have been to the pool around 1pm and every day the pool is DISGUSTING but today was the absolute worst. There is a thin film on top and bugs everywhere. For it to be such a small pool it is insane they don't have someone clean it more often.

We have received great service at T. Cooks and at the Cabana Cafe - the people who work here have been wonderful. It is really sad that part of the reason we booked the babymoon was so that I could enjoy the comforts of the pool - a clean pool and we were assured it was cleaned daily. I can assure you it is not.

Maybe it is cleaned in higher seasons but the bugs and the film are pretty rancid.

Plus side is the air conditioning in our room works and the employees are very nice. The rooms are definitely dated and when paying for a Casita you would think a "semi private terrace" would actually be semi private. Ours is not. It's actually a huge courtyard we share with several other rooms. Not a terrace at all. 

I am seriously disappointed and so sad we chose this as our place to have our last trip before the baby.
