For the price you would think they would at least offer us bottles of water (I am a Hyatt member and most Hyatt's do this) - They do not. Water is $5 a bottle...the coffee maker in the room has never been cleaned and is disgusting. Coffee is $5 a cup. 

Being pregnant and miserable - we could have done better at home. it is clear they do not care about their guests at this time of year and that this was once a decent resort. Unfortunately - I would steer clear.

One last thing of Note that is VERY important - we had this booked for months - NO ONE ever contacted us to let us know that both T. Cooks and the Mix Up Bar would be undergoing renovation. They are impossible to find every day because the signage is so bad and tehre is no true "bar" to hang out in. If you are considering booking this place before July 28th - be warned - They don't care to let you know until check in that these places are vastly different.

Amazing.  I did not stay at the hotel , but I did visit the Alvadora spa.  This spa was very warm and inviting.  I liked the fact that it was indoor and outdoor, with plenty of natural sunlight.  I used the eucalyptus steam room, and private outdoor jacuzzi prior to my treatments.  I enjoyed that these facilities were separated from the men's facilities.  The treatment room was lovely, with floor to ceiling plantation shutters that offered just enough light.  Sometimes I feel like I am in a cave when getting a massage, so this was a welcome change.  The therapist, Jennifer, was an absolute delight.  Knowledgable, professional, and a great conversation.  She did both my massage and facial.  She gave me wonderful tips on skincare, and even taught me an exercise to stretch my back after a long day at work.  The rest of the staff was very pleasant and accommodating as well.  The products used were animal, and environmentally friendly.  I will be back for sure!

Rarely do I give out five stars for hotels, but there you have it. A resort perfect in every way. My husband and I booked our stay for one night last Tuesday on the day of through the Hotel Tonight app. $100 for the room... truly a steal. There was an extra $30 resort fee tacked on that all guests must pay, and which pays gratuity for the valets and housekeepers, gives you access to the pool and fitness center, etc. The pool, by the way, is open 24 hours, which was so cool because we are such night owls and we totally had the pool all to ourselves at 1 in the morning. The pool also has floating rafts you can use for free, plus clean towels, comfy lounge chairs, cabanas, and bar service. The pool did not disappoint.

The customer service was phenomenal. The woman who checked us in was very chipper and seemed genuinely happy to have us there, and one of the valets gave us the tour of the resort and showed us to our room. He was very helpful and kind.

The room was decorated lovely, and although we had hoped for a king bed, we made do with the double beds we ended up with (apparently they were too booked to hook us up with a king bed). There is a large bathtub in the bathroom, but the wall next to it can be opened up completely, so it was like taking a bath in the bedroom. Really pretty and neat. Plus, they had candles set up, so you better believe your heiny I took advantage of those.

My only qualm is that housekeeping came knocking at our door at 11 (check out wasn't until noon), successfully waking us up as we had gone to sleep really late the night before. My husband had to run to the door before they came in, as we were both *ahem* in the nude. He ended up stubbing his toe so hard in the process that his big toenail ripped off completely and therefore effectively ending our little staycation. 

Alas, missing toenail and all, an excellent experience in every way!

Nice old Phoenix historical property. However : I checked In mid June day temps 108 degrees F. Rate was well below season rack rate at $90 bucks. But upon check in a $30.00 "resort fee" and a $15 buck parking fee not mentioned on my corporate travel portal.  Thus they are sneaky , especially in    mid June.  Rooms are great and the ambiance is fantastic. They just sock it to you for extra $$$$ at every turn. Beware. I will review the restaurant T cooks latter but what I have had so far a great roasted beer salad for $12 bucks was the size of a sampling at a restaurant week somewhere. Rip off.

The resort was small & intimate, and we really enjoyed not having a huge crowd of people to contend with. The grounds were gorgeous and immaculately maintained. Service from all staff members was enthusiastic, welcoming and super friendly. We particularly loved Steven from the pool! The pool was never so crowded you couldn't find chairs to sit in. The cushioned chairs were comfy to sit in and the misters by the patio were delightful. If any renovations are done to the pool, I would suggest adding in a shelf/seats on the side, so you could sit in the pool with your beverage ;) 

The eucalyptus steam room in the spa was heavenly! 

Our room was comfortable and clean. We didn't have any issues with noise from the hallway or our neighbors. However, the pillows were awful. They deflated the moment I put my head on them. I would have preferred if there were perhaps 2 different kinds of pillow on the bed, rather than 2 of the same kind. Or maybe another option in the closet. 

More Suggestions: I would have loved a rooftop bar, or at least one that was outdoors. Friends & I thought even a rollaway one, with some hightop tables & stools on the lawn would be a nice option for a pre-dinner drink with friends. (There is one inside, but watching the sunset would be perfect!) I also would have loved a little snack option during the day - chips and salsa maybe in the lobby? or a social hour?

My original review still rings true. I love it here. It's my staycation of choice without hesitation. I love how lush and green it is, I drive twenty minutes but feel like I'm in a completely new place. The casitas are my favorite place to stay, I'll bring little speakers and play Sinatra or Armstrong out on the patio, light up a nice cigar, have a glass of wine, play a card game, whatever I'm doing I'm happy.

I love the bar at the Royal Palms, not far off the beaten path, yet in a world unto it's own.

You can easily pass the entrance as you cruise down Camelback.  Once you turn into the drive way the valet team greets you to park your car. On the way to the bar, stroll through the lovely garden/fountain area - as you step into a more tranquil time.

The bar has a number of nooks & cranny's, four cool seating sections - the fireplace room, the tables along the windows bordering the garden, the spacious corner and up at the bar. The entire property has an early Arizona motif which is consistent in the bar with comfy chairs & couches and a wonderful mix of floor tiles.

Caitlin, our waitress was welcoming and  crisp with her spot on recommendation's.  Pork  flatbread, was a stand out appetizer with a flavorful consistency of meat, cheese and mushrooms. The Bergstrom Pinot,  a real treat, was a nice compliment to our food.

This gem of a hideaway was the perfect spot for a light bite and glass of vino on a rainy Monday night.

There is no surprise this hotel is #1. The property is amazing. Location is perfect. Service is outstanding. Food is delicious. The Spa offers some of the best services Ive ever had. Cant wait to go back!
Note: Service charges are included with everything including your car service, so no need to tip!

Beautiful hotel. Amazing customer service. Spa was great. Props to Shannon and Jerri who gave the best mani pedis we have ever had. Couples massage was wonderful.  Would have given 5 stars but I was not impressed with the menu at TCook's. Would've liked to see more salad/veggie options less cheese and meat. Also the bathtub. Uncomfortable...to narrow and deep. Hard to get in and out of. But the shower in our room was inspirational!!!

Although the resort is amazing, the staff simply doesn't care about you. The first night the bathtub flooded the entire bathroom and part of the bedroom, Jeff came stating that Sarah called him stating that the shower head wasn't working properly( I never mentioned shower head , I am not sure what she heard at this point because it wasn't even about the shower but the bathtub faucet being broken). They moved us to another room after waiting 40 minutes for someone to show up. So we thought things were going to be better but sure it wasn't the case... The second room the lighting wasn't working we didn't get room service the next day so we had to make our own bed and clean around the room. The lighting didn't work so we could barely brush our teeth and take a shower because the lighting wasn't working. The room was nice but everything else just didn't work well. The next morning we decided to go to T cooks the restaurant on the resort and I asked the lady if I could get breakfast to go. She then asks me if it's for my child . What difference does it make ???? I don't have kids and that was for my partner. Anyways, breakfast was good and I thought in everything was still okay. The valet staff was probably the best they were really helpful in giving us directions and suggestions on places to go. The next day ( today) we went to checkout and the gal asked me how was our stay and I told her about what had happened to us , she was dry and just said I am sorry. She didn't care to investigate and ask additional questions she simply didn't care. But the reason of why I am giving this resort a one star is because they assumed a lot. They charged me $100 for pet deposit, when my dog is a service dog ???? First of all they never asked, someone, I am assuming the valet or Jeff from engineering reported that we had a dog and the resort didn't care to ask, even thought when we checked in we had disclosed that our dog ( which by the way was right in front of the lady's face at time of check-in) was a service animal. They didn't care about us nor about our business. My pet peeve is not making assumption and that is all this resort did the entire time we stayed there. I would NOT recommend this place to anyone and I will make sure that the BBB hears from me about them. No sincere apology, they didn't listen effectively, made many assumptions and didn't make us feel at home. Maybe my expectations were higher due to this resort being 5 start, but I sure don't think that scenarios like the one I witnessed happen at other resorts no matter of what the star rating maybe .

I went here on my honeymoon at the end of October, a Sunday, Monday, and Tuesday. My husband and I are 29 and the crowd here was at least 40 and up. They were all business people at convention meetings, which kind of ruined the resort atmosphere. The bar was filled with older men talking about their last meeting. Everyone at the restaurant was over 60. We kind of felt ridiculous saying we were on our honeymoon. It's a nice botanical atmosphere, with fireplaces and fountains throughout, and the staff are quick to please. The food was good, not great. The front desk doesn't have any razors or personal items if you forget any.  Meh.

Alvadora Spa was a good experience, but no better than anywhere else I've been. The facial was abrupt because I had never had one before, which she knew, and she proceeded to not ask me any questions about my face, but just starting applying and removing things, then sending me on my way. I had no idea what had just happened. There wasn't anything bad about the spa... it was just a spa.

The best resort in town. If you're looking for massages, brunch or to relax by the pool. It's gorgeous. I can't wait to go back as it was the best way to relax after a long week. Thank you for the best service in town.

Probably would give it 3.5 stars but no half stars available. Others have pointed out the multiple positive findings at the RP: excellent staff, romantic setting, very good restaurant. Here are the negatives: 
It can be spendy (very) although recently they have been getting more price aggressive here. 
Rooms can be small and dark. I stayed in one of the newly remodeled "Spa suites" and would NOT recommend for the money. We never even used the living room area because of its unusual lay out. The balcony was very small as well, most appeared to be that way. 
The pool area is very small so if they are busy the place will get crowded and can be loud. I rented a cabana on a busy Saturday and it was worth the expense given the crowd. 
The spa is small but very very nice, 4-5 star.

My sister and I decided to do a little pool day and buy the day bed on resortpass.com we instantly fell in love with this place! The staff is so helpful and nice and they make you feel so welcome! I was especially impressed with the pool staff, it was well over 100 degrees and they served everyone so well and with a smile on their faces. My sister and I will definitely be coming back for another pool day!

Another day, another staycation. Am I right?  I don't know how I haven't ventured here before , but alas I did when I had friends in town. 

This property is stunning. I felt like I was back in Spain.  The property boasts a maze-like campus and it's easy to get lost.  Rather than feeling like you are on a resort property, it's set up to seem as if you are in a tiny village. Or at least that's how we felt.  

The entire venue is gorgeous and relaxing. The pool is rather small, but as a bonus there are no kids under 15 or 16 allowed.  Therefore the small pool is less annoying without screaming kids interrupting your zen.

We opted for poolside lunch while there and the veggie wrap is to die for.  It's a simple lunch item, but packed with flavor.  Grilled veggies, sprouts, hummus and pesto make for a light, yet filling lunch.  

The spa was amazing and was one of the best facials I've had in the valley. I loved the relaxation room and the smell of eucalyptus that permeated the entire spa.  AAAAHHH, clear sinuses!  My facialist was thorough, and while she did recommend a different cleanser for my face; she wasn't pushing the spa's items.. rather something more basic. Loved that. 

I'd definitely recommend staying here off season to hit the spa and resort deals. you'd never guess you were off a busy road. The resort is relaxing, offers amazing views of Camelback and is completely relaxing!
Steven at the pool, and Steve the GM were fantastic. It's a very beautiful and intimate resort. We will definitely return.

Disappointed.  Was there over the weekend and the only good thing about this resort was the pool staff.  They were the only ones who seemed to truly care for their guests.  Sebastien did not stop moving and was accommodating and attentive to every single guest and it was a busy pool day.

We rented a suite for the evening and nothing really special about it. It was dark and felt like a dungeon In sitting area.

Cabana by the pool don't waste your money,  this hotel does not seem to care about their outside furniture.  The cabana looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a month.  While walking around the property every piece of outside furniture was filthy and had bird poop all over it.  I did bring this to managements attention and he took note of it and said he would comp Cabana.  I appreciated that and said thank you.

Fast forward a few days.  I have not seen a reversal on my card.  When I called hotel to inquire I was told manager was not in and to call the next day.  I feel it is not my responsibility to follow up with you as I was your guest and asked for manager to call me.  24 hours have passed and nothing.  Received our bill via email and they tried to also charge us for a room upgrade which we did not get.  When we asked about this we were not so nicely told next time we should check out at front desk to go over the bill in detail.  I'm in customer service and it is not my customers job to police what I am supposed to be doing accurately for them.  And the only thing that should have been said on that call was no problem we will get that taken care of for you.

I will not be recommending this property to any family or friends nor will we be staying again.  It's a shame we do a staycation once a month too.
Stopped by for a walk through this stunning resort and a cocktail. Happy hour drink prices were very reasonable! Definitely would like to stay here in the future.

my then boyfriend, now fiancee took me to a wonderful spa adventure for my bday.

full body massage, facial, mani, pedi the whole works...followed by the eucalyptus steam room ~~~~ i walked out of there feeling like a million dollars baby!

this spa is beautiful and relaxing.

The Royal Palms Resort is a 150 room villa-style resort near the base of CamelBack Mountain.  The courtyards, pools, fountains, architecture, and landscaping are enchanting.  The single lane drive through the palms up to the circular drive sets the tone.  Yes, there were rabbits on the lawn in mid-afternoon.

The staff is attentive and personable; not plastic like some 5-star hotels.  Tipping was added as line item during check-in so you didn't have to rummage your pants pocket after bell service and valet.

Rooms are cozy with low ceiling and décor is area appropriate (wicker & mission) done in a classy way.  Adding to the personal touch is your choice of paper service and an in-room Keurig machine for your morning joe; Wi-Fi is free.  Bathrooms are spacious w/ rustic flair.  Bed is massive and comfy.

One minor negative thing to note is the grounds crew fired up the lawn mower at 8:30 am on the southwest side... no bueno for guests who have a nearby room and were out late the previous night.  Luckily this lasted only 5 minutes...

Didn't eat @ T. Cook's but explored the lounge separate from the dining area -good for its own identity.  Clientele was a mix of locals and tourists and, surprisingly, not stodgy like a W hotel in Manhattan. Drinks are even reasonably priced so I see the draw for locals.

Pool is heated -definitely necessary for taking a dip in late December.  The workout room is a bit smaller than expected but clean & techy w/ about 3 each of treadmills & ellipticals.  Some mats and dumbbells are available also.

The Alvadora is the onsite spa if you're so inclined.  All-in-all this hotel is an amazing value.

This place is amazing! Right when we pulled in you enter down a cobblestone driveway and are immediately greeted by the valet. The service was prompt and very kind. They led us to our dinner hall and promptly served us a drink. 

We thought the food was amazing and the atmosphere was relaxed but still very luxurious feeling. In fact we both decided we have to do a "staycation" here soon because it is that nice. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a great place to stay in Phoenix.

Wow, just wow!  What a property, we got a great summer rate through AAA and it was very worth the experience.  It is not a great property for kids so only bring the spouse if you want to get a recharge on such an awesome little place.  It only has one pool but the atmosphere is Spanish Colonial and the landscape is very mature with plants I have never seen in Phoenix.  The bar and restaurant are great little places and the service is second to none.  By far the best staycation we have taken in Phoenix so far.  There are several room styles and we picked up a suite and it was so nice inside and very comfortable.  I will stay here again before I die...hopefully sooner than later.

Anyone who can find fault with this establishment is impossible to please...period.  This resort is exceptional in nearly every way.  The grounds are extremely intimate and phenomenally well designed and maintained...exotic, cozy, sexy, exclusive, warm, inviting.  Pool , workout room, yoga and spa services - quite nice.  Quiet classical guitar playing throughout the grounds by day, candlelit and the air "scented" with a fantastic piano player at night.  The food was way above average, the staff; front desk, concierge, bartenders, valet, "chambermaids", maintenance engineers were all extremely friendly, courteous and timely.  The other patrons were mature, respectful adults and we had the best time.  One last plus from my angle: no kids...YAY!!!

We had brunch here yesterday. The staff was friendly and helpful with recommendations. The food was amazing. The graham cracker French toast was our favorite followed by the lemon ricotta pancakes. I would recommend making a reservation, the restaurant isn't that big. I look forward to visiting again when it gets cooler to enjoy the out door seating and possible a happy hour. Their bar area looked like it would be a great spot to start the evening at.

Royal Palm Resort is one of the best place to stay when in Phoenix for its tradition and for its renew beautiful remodels. It feels like a country side resort in the heart of Phoenix / Scottsdale area. Great inside and outside views of famous Phoenix mountains.
Next time in Phoenix get to know this amazing resort!

Just came from breakfast here, and it was perfect! The location is stunning and relaxing. I got the muesli, and it was wonderful. The dried fruit added the perfect amount of sugar. I also recommend the lemon ricotta pancakes... Terrific! 2 of the people at my table got it, and I had a bite. Just sweet enough! Also, a special shoutout to our waiter, Tonino. He saw our family's last name, and actually got it right, as a fellow Italian. We had a great conversation about traditional Italian pronunciation of words, and he was so spirited. Overall, a wonderful experience!
This beautiful Spanish style resort is so gorgeous and yet casual. We are in heaven - beautiful scenery, warm friendly service and indulgent amenities. We will be sorry to leave../

This is my favorite hotel. Stayed here twice; once after our wedding, and then to celebrate our anniversary. I can't say enough how wonderful it is, and in every aspect. My husband and I will be coming here for years to come.

Aesthetics: the hotel itself is dripping in old world style and art. Gorgeous features in every direction. 

Staff: so friendly, so nice, and so helpful. I had a somewhat odd request of mailing out a package via UPS, and the front desk just had me drop it off with them and they scheduled a pick-up first thing the next morning. Everyone is willing to help and very positive and friendly. 

Spa: really nice amenities at this spa; relaxation rooms, steam room, outdoor spa, etc. The massages were very nice, too. 

Room: so relaxing and awesome. Especially loved the tub, the steam shower, and the views of camelback mountain.
Lovely brunch, Bellini, omelette with crab, bousin. Delicious bread basket. Courtyard location the best. Beautiful old hotel.

The Montavista Terrace King lived up its website photos! Luxurious linens, elegant & large bathroom, quick-filling (with almost instant hot water) soaking tub, large shower.  Nice view from our comfortable balcony. Flawless check-in experience - personable staff even late at night when we checked in. Bar was still serving a limited menu - excellent service and nice food that night (see my separate reviews for our two dining experiences onsite). 

I'm not a fan of hotel booking websites - been disappointed before BUT tripadvisor offered a Hotels for Everyone deal on this room ($261+resort fee) that was 1/3 off the best price I could get from the hotel when I called in (including asking for a Sr discount). No problems getting the very nice room we reserved.

The maid service was wonderful too. Our room was super clean - frankly I don't usually remark on cleanliness unless its really bad or really good. I travel with my own blanket - this is the only time a maid has made the bed up smoothing out my blanket as I'd set it up the night before - so thoughtful! 

Why not 5 stars? 2 reasons - 1) the onsite restaurant was understaffed & poorly managed - service was horrible. (see separate review if interested). 2) poor signage - my husband was lost for over 20 mins trying to get back to our room.

Had a short business trip in Phoenix and although I did not stay at this resort, I visited the spa and pool area for the day. Let me tell you this place is beautiful!!!! I especially loved all the Spanish themed decor. It didn't feel like I was at the average resort but I felt like I was more on the grounds of a Spanish castle of some sort. The spa area is heavenly. The locker room and  steam room were very clean and relaxing. In back there's a separate jacuzzi area for the spa. Once I was done there I was able to stay at the pool area where these cute little cabanas were located. Since it was pretty hot outside the servers at the bar allowed me to sit there without making a major purchase. The entire staff was super nice! I'd definitely come back.

More stars are needed!  Outstanding service and property.  What the team here could provide to many other businesses...service  PLUS.  Truly, you must experience it!  Ask Jack or Andy where some of the best places are to eat...very helpful.  We were so impressed after our first visit in August,  we cancelled another property reservation for our stay in November so we could again stay at the Royal Palms....it was that good.

Our family (7 people) stayed here in four rooms.  We loved our rooms and that they were located in small casitas and not a huge block hotel. The landscaping and grounds are absolutely beautiful.  We enjoyed just walking around the facilities.

The pool and hot tub was very relaxing, and when we were there it was very empty.  T. Cooks restaurant was extremely good and has been one of the best meals I've had in the Phoenix area. 

We spent a day at the spa and enjoyed ourselves. The facilities are small and very pretty. We were asked to wait in the 'relaxation area' between treatments.  It was a lovely area with nice chairs, drinks etc... The very surprising thing was that it was basically the only place people could walk through, so it ended up being the least relaxing place. Every few minutes some one from the staff has to walk through the room to get from the treatment area to the front desk. Once someone even brought what looked like large laundry bags through.  It was a beautiful place and our treatments were great.  I just think the layout and timing of maintenance needs to be rethought.

Frustrations: Check in and check out was slow.  The 'front desk' area is very quaint but too small when several people are needing attention at once.  Plan to wait a while if there is anyone else waiting.  The resort made several mistakes on our bill. They fixed it but only because we caught it. Also, when we came back to our room one afternoon our door was ajar.  We checked the room and nothing was missing.  We called resort security and they were able to trace back who last opened the door with their key card (a resort employee).  It was all ok, but we could have lost our jewelry or laptop if someone had decided to take advantage of the open door.

I loved the food and beauty of the resort, but I don't think I'd stay here again because of the slow check in and out and the security problem.

This was my son's idea and gift to their Mom for Mother's Day. We had reservations for 9:45 brunch and even though we were a few minutes early, there was a nice buzz in the restaurant and they seated us right away. There was a starter buffet with just amazing smoked fishes, meats, cheeses, fresh fruits, salads and breads/pastries. There was a fixed selection of entrees, cooked to order and again, all of our dishes were excellent. Myself and one of my sons had the Surf N Turf (Lobster and Petite Filet), my other son had the scallops and my wife ordered the fish, although I cannot for the life of me remember what kind it was. I do remember however that she loved it and we all had not a single complaint! There was also a dessert buffet with every type of flavor palette you could imagine. Chocolates, truffles, cakes, creme brûlée, tarts and more. Way to go guys! AWESOME!

The Royal Palms has spacious grounds, but I did not find them to be "breathtaking" as others did. Maybe I'm spoiled since I travel a bit and go to southern CA once a month. 

Hotel:

Pros: The valet/bus boys were SO friendly and accommodating-always smiling, upbeat and ready with a cold bottle of water as your left for your summer excursion in Phx. Jenna the customer service manager is over-the-top customer service oriented, she was SO helpful! The yoga teacher was friendly and after over a decade of doing yoga, I learned some "new" mudras that I found extremely helpful. Gratuity fee of $15 covers all tips so you don't have to always be reaching for your wallet. And "Royal Palmers" (ice cold Arnold Palmers) when you check in!

Cons: We reserved a Montevista Suite with a big bathtub and were "upgraded" to a casita, which sounds good, but was in reality a handicap room that lacked a certain charm that was situated along a walkway and had the world's shallowest one-person bathtub. When we asked to be moved to the room we actually reserved, we were told they were all taken (!!) for the night and we moved the next morning. The beds were not great and the one in the handicapped room was actually quite mushy and uncomfortable. The thermostats in the rooms can be set to lower than 72 degrees, but turn off at 72 degrees at night. Well 72 degrees sounds cool, but we needed to have a fan brought in to be cool enough to sleep (and we live in Tucson so heat is not new to us). Drinks at the pool are apparently $20 each according to our bill (!!). Yoga is outside in the mornings which during monsoon season means mosquito-central. 

Restaurant/Bar:

Pros: Chuck the bartender at the Mix Up bar was also top-notch as he chatted us up and explained the specialty drink of the day. Our waiter at T Cooks for dinner was friendly enough and the food there is great! Try the antelope or the tasting menu. 

Cons: Can't think of any. 

Warning: Not knowing any better, we bought the BOGO free deal which listed room rates as $450/night with one night free came out to $225/night. The thing is the rack rate on their website for those nights was $179 and $139. So we could have saved money by getting the rack rate which I found irritating. Luckily Jenna the customer relations manager lowered our rate to the rack rate, but we had to ask and the woman who checked us out was none too happy about me asking to make sure we'd gotten the rate everyone else paid. 

Overall, a mid-range "resort" which a decent pool area, pretty gardens/grounds and at times excellent customer service. Overall I'll rate it A-OK, 3 stars. Not great, but certainly good enough (at the reduced summer prices).
Loved this place...took my mom for mothers day and we were there for 5 hours getting wonderful services and had lunch by the pool. Cant wait to go back

Totally loved it!  It's so quaint and charming.  I have been to some of the best hotels in the world, and this place rocks!  Here we go:
-charming and professional.  Not uptight like the Ritz Cartlon.  Very, very personable staff
-amazing food and will do special meals like vegan and gluten free.  Breakfast served at 6AM and coffee bar open.  So nice to be served early as some hotels have client wait till 7AM
-wonderful conceirge who helped me w local restaurants and hiking 
-amazing spa.  It's like you have the place to yourself and the staff knows what they are doing
-really nice gym w great equipment
-little nocks and crannies of fireplaces, fountains and outdoor spaces.  I want my house to look and feel like this!

I hope I get back to Phoenix just to stay here again.

There is a place, not so far away, where the wine is delicious and the tranquil sounds of divine music play. Should you arrive at this place with a desire for stomach satisfaction, the food will provide the vehicle for your satisfaction. My family came here to have dinner prior to going to Zoo Lights. Our guide was friendly and gentle. Ryn is the best and was able to direct our choices as to food and drink. We had the pizza which was okay (a little soggy) and the vegetabe plate and the hot dogs with fries and fruit. The place is best with just you and someone that you want to pounce on (super romantic) however, they are kind to children as well.

I had the great pleasure of staying at the Royal Palm Resort and Spa for a work conference (National Geographic) this past weekend. The customer service and the attention to detail were above and beyond what I would normally consider excellent, and I will tell explain why.  From the concierge to the valet, everyone was very friendly and kind.  There wasn't a question they weren't willing to answer. They were extremely helpful and willing to help.  My suite was quite impressive.  I observed how during cocktail hour and dinner, the servers diligently went around to serve us.  During dinner, they served us with such timed synchronization and precision.  What topped it off is what happened on my last day.  I was approached by one of the managers, Sebastian, inquiring on my stay.  I told him how lovely everything had been. I told him in passing that I would have liked very much to go on a hike, yet I had not packed a pair of tennis shoes with me.  This gentleman went above and beyond the duties of customer service and went to the mall and bought me a pair of sneakers.  I have no words to describe my appreciation for this act of kindness.  I would like to commend Sebastian for being so wonderfully kind and this act of generosity.  I will never forget this experience.  From the bottom of my heart, I thank you.

Went to the Royal Palms yesterday for a speaker event for about 80 people, and had one of the best experiences I've had at an event like this. Although we were just there for an hour long speaking event, then an hour of cocktails afterwards, it left a very lasting impression of being delightful.  Every detail was well thought out, from the Valet, to the water glass placements, to the ushers. I will highly recommend this location for future large events.
One of the best resorts I have stayed in. Very different setting. Extremely friendly staff. If I come to Phoenix again, I would definitely stay here. Very relaxing and clean resort. Thumbs up!

Food was delicious. The scallops were huge. I had the calamari salad and didn't care for the sauce but loved it with the pesto. The sea bass was my main entree. Full of flavor and so moist. The service was wonderful as well. Our server was fast and attentive. The atmosphere was beautiful. We sat outside and there was a nice breeze due to their huge fan. Then when the night cooled down the fan was turned off and it was perfect outside.

Guys. Seriously? This place is not living up to the hype. My husband and I went here for an overnight stay to celebrate the fact that it was our first time away from our kids, um ever in two years (no big deal) and it was a Father's Day gift. We had booked through hotels.com and relayed the importance of our visit in the reservation. I upgraded the room to a private casita and chose the option to pay at the time of the booking, as opposed to paying later. 
Imagine my surprise when, upon check-in, I am confronted immediately with,"we need a credit card for this reservation".  "I thought I paid ahead, but ok...."  The front desk attendant then informs us of the $30 resort fee and $15 overnight parking fee. Really? Y'all can't even spring for free parking for your patrons? At a so-called 4.5 star resort? Please. 
The valet gave us a tour of the grounds and he was great. Informative, funny and honest. When we tipped him he made sure we knew that a tip was already included and wasn't necessary. We knew but he deserved the tip anyway, it was just nice of him to be honest.

The stay was nice, the room was fine and dinner was good-but for a $250 check for two people I was expecting more. But what was really great happened next. Once we got home a few days passed and I spoke to my mom. She said she was surprised she didn't hear from me for a big thank you. I asked why? Well it turned out my parents paid for our stay as a nice gesture since we never get out. Odd, I thought, considering the first thing the front desk attendant did was ask for a credit card when my parents sent their info in and wanted to pay for any other incidentals above and beyond the room. I called and talked to the front desk attendant and told her the deal. She didn't sympathize, she didn't apologize, she just transferred me to the accounting department to leave a message. The following day, Eric from accounting called me back. We figured out that my card wasn't charged but there was a $300 hold on my debit that would "disappear in a week or so". Now, I don't have a lot of money, so for $300 to be tied up for a week was kind of a bummer. He keep repeating the same info about booking through hotels.com and how sometimes people who pay for rooms want to remain anonymous (I was asking why I wasn't told the room was paid for, why was I even asked to present a card when that part was handled?). He was droning on and I said, "I don't care about that, what I care about is..." I couldn't finish my sentence because Eric from accounting interrupted me and said that if I didn't care what he was saying he couldn't help me any further. Then he HUNG UP ON ME! I mean come on! Where's the hospitality? I was furious. I wanted to be done with the shitty ordeal but my friend persuaded me to call again and let management know what happened. So I did. I told her that I didn't want anything from them, that I simply would never come back. She assured me that she would take this higher and have it corrected. With all the awesome deals in the valley during the summer why throw it away on this place? Spend your hard earned money some place else.

This is my favorite hotel to stay at in Arizona. It's a boutique hotel which I love, no chains here. The pool area is so nice, and the rooms are amazing!!! They have different styles and names of the rooms. The hotel makes you feel like your in a garden somewhere magical.

T Cooks restaurant is inside and it's sooooo yummy! I go here with my girls.
My husband and I went there for Christmas brunch a couple of years ago and had a very nice dining experience.  A little bit cold inside, but aside from that, everything was perfect!!!

Driving into the Royal Palms compound set the stage for a great lunch experience. The grounds and landscaping are great, colorful and relaxing, however it was the restaurant that left me smiling. We did not have a reservation during a rather busy holiday lunch crowd, but the maitre de'offered a table on the outside patio. I was all for that, but the people I went with were feeling chilled (being from Tucson and 60 is winter) and hesitated just a bit before saying the patio would be okay. The maitre de saw that short hesitation and made room for us in the dining room. All of the wait staff were just as attentive and perceptive. The food was very good, my cafe latte was fantastic. 
For the price of a mediocre lunch at Applebees I had a great experience at the Royal Palms.

This review is for the Alvadora Spa at the Royal Palms Resort.  My friend planned an amazing weekend in Scottsdale and our day at this resort was relaxing and fun.  This Spanish-style resort is quaint with a very European feel.

I had a deep tissue massage, and it was among the best I've ever had.  Even better is that with any treatment, you can enjoy the rest of the resort for the balance of the day.  Coming from the Chicago winter, we chose to lay by the pool, basking in the Arizona sun with a couple of cocktails.  Perfect way to spend a girl's weekend away!

This is a wonderful intimate boutique style hotel where everything is a close walk, not long distances  like the large resort style hotels.  The service is impeccable throughout.  It is situated in the middle of Scottsdale close to everything, but you feel like you have been transported to a place in colonial Mexico or Tuscany, the gardens awe amazing We stayed in a room that backed up to the street and one could hear traffic in the mornings, but this did not bother me in the least.  I will definitely return to this gem.

Agree with those who describe this place as enchanting.  The rooms are extremely comfortable, the grounds are picture perfect and the pools are very pretty.  We had 8 people in our group ages 15-64 and everyone found something they loved about this place.

By far, one of my most favorite places in Arizona. And I'm a second generation native, I know a lot about this state and a lot about the hidden treasures. This is one of them.

I've been meaning to write a review for sometime as its been quite awhile since we stayed here.

My husband and I got married on April 11, 2009. It was the night before Easter and we had a room booked here. It was not only a holiday weekend but a popular wedding day, so we were competing with a lot of other couples.

We showed up somewhere between 11:30-midnight to check in. Checking in before us was also another bride and groom who apparently got the last regular room. When we got to the front desk we were told they had overbooked. We were crushed as we really wanted to stay here and didn't know what our options were going to be., especially it being so late into the night. Without hesitation we were upgraded to the honeymoon suite, and on them! The staff was so nice, and prompt. It took us less than 10 minutes to check in, even with an upgrade. 

Everyone was so nice. The service was great. The room was huge, beautiful and we had 2 private patios. I wish we were able to stay for more than one night to really appreciate all the amenities. There was a large shower, a separate tub, a living room with lots of seating, and a bedroom with a large king bed. The linens were amazing and so soft. It was just the best experience! 

We ordered room service the next morning before check-out. The food was amazing, it came quickly, and again, the staff was amazing. 

I have no complaints about this place other than I wish we could have stayed a week instead of a night. Highly recommend!

Royal Palms is easily in my top 3 resorts in Phoenix. This quaint resort is nestled into camelback mtn and feels like you are miles away from the hustle and bustle of PHX. Whether you are going for a cocktail on one of their many patios, or your staying overnight you will not be let down. The bar and T. Cooks have been renovated to provide more space and maintains the perfect ambiance. The rooms at the Royal Palms are a great extension of the overall resort. Beautiful warm rooms that will give you the comfort of home, but the luxury of a 5 star resort. Go for drinks or for the night, you won't be disappointed!

Ideal small, intimate resort with stellar service!  They earned my repeat business.  If you're looking for a large, 5 start Ritz Carlton, go to the Ritz.  If you're looking for a gorgeous setting with a Tuscan vibe, gardens, fountains, nooks crannies and one-on-one service it's ideal.  It's not perfect, but as a frequent traveler it wins in my book!

Resort fee covers all tips - not a usual perk!  Employees still go above and beyond.  Michael S. In valet, Robert and Matt at pool all extraordinary.  We didn't want for anything.  Parking is $15 for one vehicle but only a one time fee and you can go in and out.  This is also a deal for resorts.

We had a travel zoo voucher and were on a tight budget so we used food credits in Mix up Bar.  Great wine, good food but very limited and neither Mix Up or TJ Cooks good for vegans.  TJ Cooks well known and smelled delicious and I'll eat there next time when not on budget travel.

Pool great, but smaller so reserve chairs early.  We never waited for service or water or towels!  These are the perks of smaller property!  Water was very cold but would be good in hotter weather.  Hot tub was too hot to use.

Since we were on a budget we didn't get to use our $40 spa credits because it was limited to massage or body work for 50min or more.  We did get to do free yoga class which was awesome!  Will be better outside when bugs aren't biting.  We also got to use steam room (even though we didn't get services - another perk of smaller property.)  Spa smaller but luxurious with amenities, steam room, showers, small private hot tub women only, and good lotions.

My only complaints were room service dishes all over property and not picked up despite employees out and about.  And better vegan food options.  That sent us off property to close restaurants.  Either way I'll be back.  Rooms were great, romantic, big beds, robes, big bathroom, dressing room, separate bag area and nice showers.  Check for tub if you want to take a bath.  Don't hesitate... great place!

I am really going against my better judgment in writing this review. Am I wildly, madly in love with everything at the Royal Palms resort? Absolutely!!! Do I want you to go there?? NO! But only because I want this place completely to myself! Located off Camelback at the base of the beautiful Camelback mountain, this boutique resort is a little slice of heaven in the middle of Scottsdale. From the towering palm trees to the lush green foliage to the heady aroma of flowers everywhere you go, this place is an oasis of beauty and relaxation. 

My favorite time to go to the Royal Palms is at night, when the twinkle lights wink at you from hidden corners, and candle glow from the various secluded tables light your way from nook to nook. I recommend going around 8, when the live music starts. Listen to the bluesy singer's sultry, melancholy voice as you enjoy a glass of wine on the garden patio. Or perhaps take a romantic stroll across the grounds until you come across a secret garden tucked away, waiting for you to find it. 

The restaurant and bar are top notch, and have a great happy hour that lasts until 6pm Monday through Thursday. Or, if it's a hot summer day, take a little stay-cation and relax by the gorgeous pool in your own private cabana. 

The entire property is enchanting, and makes you feel like you've stepped into a place where time stands still, and the only thing to do is enjoy the tranquility that surrounds you. But like I said, you really shouldn't go there......

We came here for a romantic three-night getaway on our anniversary and stayed in a very spacious Alvadora Villa right outside the spa. Valet service promptly greeted us upon arrival. Those guys were great. I appreciated them always asking, "Will you be needing your vehicle shortly or should we park it in the garage?" Plus, they were always speedy about getting our car for us when we phoned them from our room. The front desk clerks were pleasant and there was always delicious complimentary Royal Palmer (aka Arnold Palmer + Grenadine) in the lobby.
After setting our things down in our room, we took a late night tour of the resort. Wow! Absolutely gorgeous resort! It's a decent sized resort yet has a small Mediterranean-style feel to it. Since we were hungry, we stopped by T.Cook's Lounge. There was live jazz music and the food was delicious. Be sure to order a Moscow mule.
The following morning, we went to the pool. All the pool servers were extremely attentive. As soon as we walked up to the chairs we wanted, they laid towels down for us and brought out large glasses of iced water. Talk about amazing service! The pool food was good, not great, but we didn't expect too much when it comes to poolside food. The pool area was very quiet and relaxing. Highlight of hanging at the pool? I got stung by a bee in the armpit as I was sunbathing on the pool float bed. Went from relaxed to freak out mode. Awesome! That would only happen to me. After much relaxing in the sun, we went for a hike on Camelback Mountain. Definitely a must. The scenery from up there is pretty cool.
That evening, I managed to break the on/off handle to the bathroom shower as I went to turn it off. And I tell ya, that water came rushing out and pinned me to the wall! As I screamed for help, my significant other yelled out from the loo to see what was going on. It was Dra-matic like only something that would happen in a movie!  Luckily, their maintenance guys responded very quickly and took care of the issue. Oops!
All-in-all, we had an amazing and relaxing time here. I'd highly recommend staying here while visiting the Phoenix area. You won't regret it.
Things we loved about Royal Palms Resort & Spa:
Gratuities were included in the resort fee.
Amazing service from everyone. We were greeted with smiles by all employees everywhere we went on property.
This would be a wonderful place to host a wedding.  Hint, hint, wink, wink.
They had cute resident bunnies hopping around property.
Live music at T.Cook's.
Steam shower.
Private outdoor shower.
Very spacious rooms and clean room.
Free WiFi.
Complimentary Royal Palmer (aka Arnold Palmer + Grenadine) at the front desk.
Surrounding scenery.

Worst experience ever at "4 Star" resort!!! We stayed here mid July for our Mini-honeymoon. My wife and I were married on Friday July 17th and had a reservation for Friday and Saturday night. We arrived at around 11:45 PM and checked in. I gave them my MC/Debit card and they charged $650 which I understood because we used debit. The next day they had no record of the charge and even told me they didnt have a card on file.  I showed the manager it was still charged to my account as a charge of $650 for Royal Palms and emailed her a copy. She asked for the card again and promised she would only run it for 1.00 just to have card on file. Over the next 24HRs they charged $449.01, $1.00, $200, $100 and $49. The next morning I complained and the front desk acted like it was no big deal even though it was coming direct out of my available funds. Two days later they were still charging my card. To cut this short because of Royal palms I incurred two NSF fees and had to use anoth card to pay my insurance. They have no respect for the working class!!!! Plus they never returned my calls after I left.

This is a great place for a staycation!!!  It really feels like you are at a Mexican resort.  We went in July and got good use of the pool.  It is smaller, but served it's purpose of relaxation and had really attentive service.  The rooms are very nice and romantic.   They have a great lounge with live music and excellent mixologists.  I didn't get a chance to try the  restaurant, so I will definitely return for that, as I have read and heard great things.  If I remember correctly, all tips are included so no need to worry about awkwardly pulling out your wallet.  Highly recommend!

My hubby and I celebrated our first wedding anniversary by staying at the Royal Palms Resort. We journeyed windy walkways surrounded by manicured lawns, beautiful trees and blooming flowers. Our casita was lovely, private and had an incredible view of Camelback mountain. The staff surprised us by delivering a plate of yummy chocolates that said Happy Anniversary on it. We enjoyed a delicious dinner at romantic, Mediterranean T Cooks. We relaxed in the jacuzzi under the stars. The service at the hotel and the restaurant was impeccable-everyone was very friendly favorite person was James-the bellman-he has been there many years and really knew the history of the resort. We enjoyed the intimacy of this smaller resort-it was a memorable celebration, worth the investment and we plan to go back.

Romantic, cozy and beautiful environs. The staff is top notch. Our room had a comfortable king-sized bed and a warm gas-fired fireplace. The decor is sort of rustic Spanish Mediterranean.  Always the mark of a great hotel, they will deliver the New York Times to your room each morning.  Be sure to have a cocktail -- I recommend the Pepino Diablo -- in the Cigar Room at the end of the evening. This is easily one of our favorite hotels in the United States!

I won't ever stay or recommend the Royal Palms Hotel!  I tried booking a room with a gift certificate - which they were not willing to honor 1 of the days (the information on the certificate is extremely misleading).  When the representative told me we could "book the room now and I could talk with the manager later", I said ok.  After booking and specifically asking which room type the certificate qualifies for - he said "either".  So I booked the larger room.  After giving him my credit card (assuming it was for incidentals) he tried to tell me to have a nice night and hang up.  I reminded him that I still wanted to speak with the manager about the second night.  I was transferred to the front desk - I asked for a manager and was given reservations --- AGAIN!  I explained why I wanted the manager and when he looked up my reservation - the gift certificate wasn't even mentioned on the reservation!!!  I was then told I couldn't use it for those dates.  Now - I'm really mad!  After explaining my 38 minute conversation with the other representative it was clear he was not going to help.  I told him to cancel the reservation (I was still ON the SAME call I made the reservation with) - he told me he'd have to see if he could WAIVE THE CANCELLATION FEE!!  It's clear this hotel has lost all sense of customer service!  I'll never recommend this hotel again - 38 minutes of nightmare!
Fantastic place!  Great service, rooms are unique and food is excellent. Property is beautiful as well. Great place to have a management meeting or even a "hide away retreat" with someone special!

Perhaps the nicest place I have ever stayed at...
We stayed there the night of our wedding, before we headed to the airport in the morning for our honeymoon.  I don't know where to start, this place is overall phenomenal.  We were treated like royalty the whole time and we had the best service imaginable.

I attended an anniversary at the Royal Palms, and was so taken with it that I booked a room and treatments... I only live a few minutes away, and I didn't go home all weekend.

It is everything you would expect from an exclusive resort. Every last detail is perfect. The ambience is intoxicating, and the service is the best in the Southwest. The meal they catered for the anniversary was above average, and my meal at the restaurant was superb. 

Tourists who are looking for Sedona-style views, remember that Scottsdale is a major city. Locals might be put off by the Southwest decor in the rooms (it's not my favorite, though still well-excecuted here). I probably wouldn't go just for the spa treatments, but they were still excellent.

Without a doubt the finest hotel services, location, design, decorating, layout etc.. than anything else anywhere. Fabulous restaurant.
Come and stay often.
thomas brodek

So we picked this hotel as a romantic get away through Hotwire. When we arrived there was some mix up  with the room that Hotwire didn't know about but the hotel did. We apparently had the room cancelled, yet nobody told us. This was after 9.30pm at night. Long story short the manager was able to put us in the main suite for one night and we moved rooms for the next night. 

The pool was great, and we hired a cabana for a hundred dollars which was nice as the service was stepped up a level and it also had a fan.

The food at the bar and music entertainment was good with an intimate feel.

This hotel is perfect for couples wanting an romantic get away.

Service was outstanding.  Room was lovely and spacious. The staff couldn't have been nicer, more supportive, and more attentive.  The grounds were immaculate.  It was like this large beautiful oasis in the middle of town. 
My wife spent many hours in the spa   She got a hot stone massage (thanks Stacey) and many off hours in the steam room, jacuzzi, relaxation room and by the fire just reading and drinking tea and having snacks. 
The bar was just perfect...cozy, great service, great menu.  The steak bites...awesome.  Ok, I loved that bar.  We only had breakfast at the main restaurant...expensive but delicious 

We will return.

Yesterday, I spent the day at the Spa. My facial was just OK, nothing special. This review, however, is specifically for the 2 young men working as attendants at the pool (one was Steven, forgot the second one's name)... they were excellent. They came around every 15 minutes, refilling our waters. They were polite, helpful when it came to putting up/taking down the umbrellas, and did a great job with our lunch orders. They made the experience top-notch.
The grounds are gorgeous. Interior and decor are rustic chic. I am in love with this place! I will be back for sure :)
This place is so quaint and awesome. Service excellent.  Food and T Cooks restaurant is unique and 5 star.  Beautiful  atmosphere.  Well organized.

This review is a little late, but me and my girlfriend stayed at the Royal Palms for two nights over July 4th weekend.  Once you get on the grounds it is like you have left Phoenix.  The staff was exceptional.  We had a Valencia Casita which is so private and roomy.  I enjoyed the exercise room on second floor which offered a view.  The pool area is ok, but don't expect towels too early in the morning.  My girlfriend had a massage at the spa and was very happy.  The bar and restaurant are first rate.  Overall has become one of our favorite places.

We had a wonderful stay on a resent trip to Arizona. We loved the history of the place and the grounds were beautiful. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. Our room was very comfortable and clean. Loved the towels. All in all we had a great stay.

Great old-school Resort in the Phoenix Paradise Valley area. I have been here many many times and it does not disappoint. Beautiful architecture Landscaping attentive friendly staff and a great place to stay if you're in the Phoenix area

The Royal Palms is a beautiful and classic Phoenix resort.  Just driving up the palm lined driveway gives you the feel of elegance and class.  The staff is very professional and courteous, and the rooms are beautifully decorated -- they have a Southwest feel with all the modern conveniences.  Simply gorgeous!  The only drawback is that pool area is kind of small, so there is not much seating.  Otherwise, this place is pretty fantastic.

Stunning, gorgeous, heavenly!  I have a new-found like for the desert...if it's going to be at a place like this.

Impeccable, friendly service, extremely accommodating.  Excellently appointed rooms.  There was a giant tub in my room that I didn't even jump in (why???).  There were nice smells everywhere.

I was here for a wedding and had an amazing view of the mountain behind the hotel....very pretty at both dusk and dawn.

This place is both peaceful and cozy.  The beds were super comfy.

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a relaxing and care-free getaway....you won't have to do a damn thing but get there.

The service here at Royal Palms Resort is Spa is top notch.  They really value their customers.  One of the first days, the cleaning staff either didn't do a good job or forgot about our room.  When I reported this to the front desk, they were very apologetic and told they would contact the Executive from the cleaning department.  In addition to that, they provided money credit and other money saving perks to help us with our situation.

The resort is truly well decorated as we dressed up and took pictures around the property.  The proximity to Camelback makes this resort even more breathtaking.

For the past 15 years I have had nothing but great things to say about the Royal Palms Resort.  My wife and I have stayed there many times over the last 15 years.  It was our favorite getaway.  It's everything we look for in a resort.  It's a shame that they have ruined our high opinion of them. My wife and I purchased the "Royal Romance" package about 6 weeks ago to celebrate my birthday and our 29th anniversary. Everything was beautiful (as usual) and the service staff excellent (as usual). The casita we stayed in was more run down than we remembered and the steaks we had for our meal were sub-standard but those problems we could live with.  The real problem was the final billing.  The package cost in the neighborhood of $550.00 and included several perks.  When we checked out they charged us $950.00 for the room and other items!  We voiced our concern upon checking out with the front desk and they told us they must have charged us for a villa instead of the casita.  Unfortunately it was Sunday and they already charged our card.  They suggested we call Marilee in accounting, which we did.  Long story short, 9 phone calls and 6 weeks later and we have no resolve.  Marilee said they were waiting for accounting to credit our card for the $400.00 error and this was a month ago.  Now she just ignores my calls. It really is a shame that they destroyed our image of this beautiful resort.  In addition, My wife and I were planning to renew our vows at the Royal Palms next May for our 30th anniversary.  We were inviting a small group of family and friends to join us.  It looks like we will have to find another location.  Jim Scott
Everything was great, just not really impressed with the room/casita. It's a great place, my rating is only based on comparison with other hotels with equivalent pricing.

The facilities were really nice. I loved the pool and eucalyptus steam room, and the grounds were beautiful! 

My massage was just okay though. My therapist got me late so it ended up only being a 40-minute massage instead of 50 minutes. Not enough time to release my tension. I still had knots in my back and neck when I left. This was not acceptable for how expensive it is. It could have just been my therapist though. I overheard other people raving about their massages.

Wow, when I die...is this heaven? Almost

The grounds of Royal Palms is heavenly and the casitas are very well appointed.  You cannot hear a peep from the outside, once you close your door. The entire staff is super friendly - almost cult-like, in a good way. 

The pool is small, but peaceful - the poolside servers are always there with your ice water w/ lemon.  Order the Royal Palmer, which is their house cocktail.  Very refreshing, yet strong.  Downside of the pool ambiance is the staticky radio.  For a place like Royal Palms, you would think they would install a better sound system with some down tempo music in loop. 

Other downside is their pillows - too soft and flat.  I kept meaning to call the front desk to ask for firmer pillows.  I'm sure they would have some. 

Other than that - The Royal Palms is pretty close to perfect, sans any car envy when your Honda Insight is sandwiched between a Lambo and a Ferrari.

I have lived in Phoenix for just over a year and my fiancé surprised with a two night stay at the Royal Palms resort for my birthday this past weekend. This resort has always been at the top of my list to stay since every time we drive past it, the entrance looks incredible. I was more than thrilled when I found out we would be spending two nights there! 

Since my fiancé had to work one of the days, he invited my girlfriends to accompany me to the hotel pool. Upon arriving, the resort was as impressive as I had hoped for and we were greeted nicely by the valet service. We asked for self parking and was directed to go down to the garage located nearby. The other two cars ended up using valet but they weren't offered the self parking option and ended up tipping the valet. No big deal but the option would have been nice.

The reception area is a small room with two love seats and while intimate, it wasn't as grand as I expected. Checkin was fast but since we arrived at 9:30am I was told that we could use the pool until the room was ready and we could change in the spa. We made our way to the spa and the grounds are very beautiful. Everything is green and lush, a big contrast from the desert this time of year. There are lots of fountains and intimate seating arrangements through out the property. The spa staff was friendly but the spa did seem a bit small. The locker area was small and only two stalls with toilets and another two shower stalls. Again, this is a boutique resort though and it matched the architecture and the finishes were all nice in the area. 

The pool chairs are very comfy and have large towels that won't slip down the chair.  I was surprised to see that one of the towels on my girlfriend's chair was nearly warn through in several places. That's not something you see in a five star resort. Friendly wait staff came by within 10 minutes and gave us each a big plastic cup of lemon water. The pool is small but there were numerous chairs around the pool. The pool temperature was great and the landscaping was very nice. Something that was really disappointing was there was no music. After looking around further, I realized there aren't speakers except in the bathroom. I've never been to a resort pool without music so it was a bit... quiet. I'm all for quiet and relaxing but at times, it was TOO quite. On the second day there was a family there with their kids and it made their splashing and loud talking all the more noticeable. Also, they had three pool floaters that had definitely seen better days. I'm not sure why this resort wouldn't replace them? It seems like such a small, easy and inexpensive thing to do. Pool service was a bit sparse and several times we had to make our way to the bar to order items.  We always had to ask for everything which was unusual. Menus, towels, water....nothing seemed preemptive on their end. Additionally, the second day, the area was a mess. Towels everywhere, chairs not setup for the next guest, empty drinks on several tables. I think there was only one person working but I still wouldn't expect to see that at a resort of this caliber. There were also several ugly crows in the area that were very aggressive.  One landed on my friend as she ate her lunch and the waiter told us a story of how just the other day one dive bombed a customer and took her taco. Ummm, aren't there bird wranglers or something? 

Our room was ready by 12pm and we were in an upgraded Valencia Casita. We were way in the back of the property and were directly next to another resort. Upon entering the room, they did have a nice plate of chocolate fudge and fruit and said Happy Birthday on the plate. Unfortunately, my birthday wasn't until the next day but it was a nice gesture. 

The room was nice but it did seem a bit dark. The ceilings were low and the exposed beams on the ceiling added to the feeling. The furnishings and the bathroom finishes were nice. The tile floors added some character and it was nice having a Keurig machine in the room.  The shower had great pressure and nice tile. Our bed was comfy but it was really high off the ground so it was a definite jump to get in. The pillows were both flat, one down and one regular cotton fill. The nightly turn down service gave you two tiny water bottles on your bedside and filled the ice bucket. On our second day, we left the room at 10am and returned at 2pm and the room had yet to be cleaned. Our turndown service came around 7:30pm the second day and left a dirty plate outside our door. 

Overall, the resort is nice but that's just it. Nice. For the value and the reputation, it wasn't up to my expectations. I expected to be wowed by this place but it just never happened.
